summary.long: Jeremiah is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The words of Jeremiah the son of Hilkiah, one of the priests who were in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came to him in the days of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah, in the thirteenth year of his reign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It came also in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, to the end of the eleventh year of Zedekiah, the son of Josiah, king of Judah, to the carrying away of Jerusalem captive in the fifth month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Before I formed you in the womb, I knew you.
    Before you were born, I sanctified you.
    I have appointed you a prophet to the nations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, “Ah, Lord Yahweh! Behold, I don’t know how to speak; for I am a child.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Yahweh said to me, “Don’t say, ‘I am a child;’ for you must go to whomever I send you, and you must say whatever I command you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t be afraid because of them, for I am with you to rescue you,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh stretched out his hand and touched my mouth. Then Yahweh said to me, “Behold, I have put my words in your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I have today set you over the nations and over the kingdoms, to uproot and to tear down, to destroy and to overthrow, to build and to plant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moreover Yahweh’s word came to me, saying, “Jeremiah, what do you see?”
I said, “I see a branch of an almond tree.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh said to me, “You have seen well; for I watch over my word to perform it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh’s word came to me the second time, saying, “What do you see?”
I said, “I see a boiling cauldron; and it is tipping away from the north.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh said to me, “Out of the north, evil will break out on all the inhabitants of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For behold, I will call all the families of the kingdoms of the north,” says Yahweh.
“They will come, and they will each set his throne at the entrance of the gates of Jerusalem,
    and against all its walls all around, and against all the cities of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will utter my judgments against them concerning all their wickedness,
    in that they have forsaken me,
    and have burned incense to other gods,
    and worshiped the works of their own hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You therefore put your belt on your waist, arise, and say to them all that I command you. Don’t be dismayed at them, lest I dismay you before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For behold, I have made you today a fortified city, an iron pillar, and bronze walls against the whole land—against the kings of Judah, against its princes, against its priests, and against the people of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will fight against you, but they will not prevail against you; for I am with you”, says Yahweh, “to rescue you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Go and proclaim in the ears of Jerusalem, saying, ‘Yahweh says,
“I remember for you the kindness of your youth,
    your love as a bride,
how you went after me in the wilderness,
    in a land that was not sown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel was holiness to Yahweh,
    the first fruits of his increase.
All who devour him will be held guilty.
    Evil will come on them,”’ says Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear Yahweh’s word, O house of Jacob, and all the families of the house of Israel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh says,
“What unrighteousness have your fathers found in me,
    that they have gone far from me,
and have walked after worthless vanity,
    and have become worthless?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They didn’t say, ‘Where is Yahweh who brought us up out of the land of Egypt,
    who led us through the wilderness,
    through a land of deserts and of pits,
    through a land of drought and of the shadow of death,
    through a land that no one passed through,
    and where no man lived?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I brought you into a plentiful land
    to eat its fruit and its goodness;
but when you entered, you defiled my land,
    and made my heritage an abomination.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The priests didn’t say, ‘Where is Yahweh?’
    and those who handle the law didn’t know me.
The rulers also transgressed against me,
    and the prophets prophesied by Baal
    and followed things that do not profit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore I will yet contend with you,” says Yahweh,
    “and I will contend with your children’s children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For pass over to the islands of Kittim, and see.
    Send to Kedar, and consider diligently,
    and see if there has been such a thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Has a nation changed its gods,
    which really are no gods?
    But my people have changed their glory for that which doesn’t profit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Be astonished, you heavens, at this
    and be horribly afraid.
    Be very desolate,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For my people have committed two evils:
    they have forsaken me, the spring of living waters,
    and cut out cisterns for themselves: broken cisterns that can’t hold water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is Israel a slave?
    Is he born into slavery?
    Why has he become a captive?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The young lions have roared at him and raised their voices.
    They have made his land waste.
    His cities are burned up, without inhabitant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children also of Memphis and Tahpanhes have broken the crown of your head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Haven’t you brought this on yourself,
    in that you have forsaken Yahweh your God, when he led you by the way?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now what do you gain by going to Egypt, to drink the waters of the Shihor?
    Or why do you go on the way to Assyria, to drink the waters of the River?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Your own wickedness will correct you,
    and your backsliding will rebuke you.
Know therefore and see that it is an evil and bitter thing,
    that you have forsaken Yahweh your God,
    and that my fear is not in you,” says the Lord, Yahweh of Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For long ago I broke off your yoke,
    and burst your bonds.
You said, ‘I will not serve;’
    for on every high hill and under every green tree you bowed yourself,
    playing the prostitute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet I had planted you a noble vine,
    a pure and faithful seed.
    How then have you turned into the degenerate branches of a foreign vine to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For though you wash yourself with lye,
    and use much soap,
    yet your iniquity is marked before me,” says the Lord Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How can you say, ‘I am not defiled.
    I have not gone after the Baals’?
See your way in the valley.
    Know what you have done.
You are a swift dromedary traversing her ways,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a wild donkey used to the wilderness, that sniffs the wind in her craving.
    When she is in heat, who can turn her away?
    All those who seek her will not weary themselves. In her month, they will find her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Keep your feet from being bare,
    and your throat from thirst.
But you said, ‘It is in vain.
    No, for I have loved strangers,
    and I will go after them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As the thief is ashamed when he is found,
    so the house of Israel is ashamed—
    they, their kings, their princes, their priests, and their prophets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who tell wood, ‘You are my father,’
    and a stone, ‘You have given birth to me,’
for they have turned their back to me,
    and not their face,
    but in the time of their trouble they will say, ‘Arise, and save us!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But where are your gods that you have made for yourselves?
    Let them arise, if they can save you in the time of your trouble,
    for you have as many gods as you have towns, O Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Why will you contend with me?
    You all have transgressed against me,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have struck your children in vain.
    They received no correction.
Your own sword has devoured your prophets,
    like a destroying lion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Generation, consider Yahweh’s word.
    Have I been a wilderness to Israel?
    Or a land of thick darkness?
Why do my people say, ‘We have broken loose.
    We will come to you no more’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Can a virgin forget her ornaments,
    or a bride her attire?
    Yet my people have forgotten me for days without number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How well you prepare your way to seek love!
    Therefore you have even taught the wicked women your ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also the blood of the souls of the innocent poor is found in your skirts.
    You didn’t find them breaking in,
    but it is because of all these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Yet you said, ‘I am innocent.
    Surely his anger has turned away from me.’
“Behold, I will judge you,
    because you say, ‘I have not sinned.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you go about so much to change your ways?
    You will be ashamed of Egypt also,
    as you were ashamed of Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: “They say, ‘If a man puts away his wife, and she goes from him, and becomes another man’s, should he return to her again?’ Wouldn’t that land be greatly polluted? But you have played the prostitute with many lovers; yet return again to me,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Lift up your eyes to the bare heights, and see! Where have you not been lain with? You have sat waiting for them by the road, as an Arabian in the wilderness. You have polluted the land with your prostitution and with your wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the showers have been withheld and there has been no latter rain; yet you have had a prostitute’s forehead and you refused to be ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will you not from this time cry to me, ‘My Father, you are the guide of my youth!’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Will he retain his anger forever? Will he keep it to the end?’ Behold, you have spoken and have done evil things, and have had your way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, Yahweh said to me in the days of Josiah the king, “Have you seen that which backsliding Israel has done? She has gone up on every high mountain and under every green tree, and has played the prostitute there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I said after she had done all these things, ‘She will return to me;’ but she didn’t return, and her treacherous sister Judah saw it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw when, for this very cause, that backsliding Israel had committed adultery, I had put her away and given her a certificate of divorce, yet treacherous Judah, her sister, had no fear, but she also went and played the prostitute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because she took her prostitution lightly, the land was polluted, and she committed adultery with stones and with wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet for all this her treacherous sister, Judah, has not returned to me with her whole heart, but only in pretense,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to me, “Backsliding Israel has shown herself more righteous than treacherous Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go, and proclaim these words toward the north, and say, ‘Return, you backsliding Israel,’ says Yahweh; ‘I will not look in anger on you, for I am merciful,’ says Yahweh. ‘I will not keep anger forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only acknowledge your iniquity, that you have transgressed against Yahweh your God, and have scattered your ways to the strangers under every green tree, and you have not obeyed my voice,’” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Return, backsliding children,” says Yahweh, “for I am a husband to you. I will take one of you from a city, and two from a family, and I will bring you to Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give you shepherds according to my heart, who will feed you with knowledge and understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will come to pass, when you are multiplied and increased in the land in those days,” says Yahweh, “they will no longer say, ‘the ark of Yahweh’s covenant!’ It will not come to mind. They won’t remember it. They won’t miss it, nor will another be made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time they will call Jerusalem ‘Yahweh’s Throne;’ and all the nations will be gathered to it, to Yahweh’s name, to Jerusalem. They will no longer walk after the stubbornness of their evil heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days the house of Judah will walk with the house of Israel, and they will come together out of the land of the north to the land that I gave for an inheritance to your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But I said, ‘How I desire to put you among the children, and give you a pleasant land, a goodly heritage of the armies of the nations!’ and I said, ‘You shall call me “My Father”, and shall not turn away from following me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Surely as a wife treacherously departs from her husband, so you have dealt treacherously with me, house of Israel,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A voice is heard on the bare heights, the weeping and the petitions of the children of Israel; because they have perverted their way, they have forgotten Yahweh their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Return, you backsliding children, and I will heal your backsliding.
“Behold, we have come to you; for you are Yahweh our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly help from the hills, the tumult on the mountains, is in vain. Truly the salvation of Israel is in Yahweh our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the shameful thing has devoured the labor of our fathers from our youth, their flocks and their herds, their sons and their daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us lie down in our shame, and let our confusion cover us; for we have sinned against Yahweh our God, we and our fathers, from our youth even to this day. We have not obeyed Yahweh our God’s voice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you will return, Israel,” says Yahweh, “if you will return to me, and if you will put away your abominations out of my sight; then you will not be removed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you will swear, ‘As Yahweh lives,’ in truth, in justice, and in righteousness. The nations will bless themselves in him, and they will glory in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh says to the men of Judah and to Jerusalem, “Break up your fallow ground, and don’t sow among thorns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Circumcise yourselves to Yahweh, and take away the foreskins of your heart, you men of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem; lest my wrath go out like fire, and burn so that no one can quench it, because of the evil of your doings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Declare in Judah, and publish in Jerusalem; and say, ‘Blow the trumpet in the land!’ Cry aloud and say, ‘Assemble yourselves! Let’s go into the fortified cities!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Set up a standard toward Zion. Flee for safety! Don’t wait; for I will bring evil from the north, and a great destruction.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A lion has gone up from his thicket, and a destroyer of nations. He is on his way. He has gone out from his place, to make your land desolate, that your cities be laid waste, without inhabitant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this, clothe yourself with sackcloth, lament and wail; for the fierce anger of Yahweh hasn’t turned back from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It will happen at that day,” says Yahweh, “that the heart of the king will perish, along with the heart of the princes. The priests will be astonished, and the prophets will wonder.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, “Ah, Lord Yahweh! Surely you have greatly deceived this people and Jerusalem, saying, ‘You will have peace;’ whereas the sword reaches to the heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time it will be said to this people and to Jerusalem, “A hot wind blows from the bare heights in the wilderness toward the daughter of my people, not to winnow, nor to cleanse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A full wind from these will come for me. Now I will also utter judgments against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, he will come up as clouds, and his chariots will be as the whirlwind. His horses are swifter than eagles. Woe to us! For we are ruined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jerusalem, wash your heart from wickedness, that you may be saved. How long will your evil thoughts lodge within you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a voice declares from Dan, and publishes evil from the hills of Ephraim:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell the nations, behold, publish against Jerusalem, ‘Watchers come from a far country, and raise their voice against the cities of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As keepers of a field, they are against her all around, because she has been rebellious against me,’” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Your way and your doings have brought these things to you. This is your wickedness, for it is bitter, for it reaches to your heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My anguish, my anguish! I am pained at my very heart! My heart trembles within me. I can’t hold my peace, because you have heard, O my soul, the sound of the trumpet, the alarm of war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Destruction on destruction is decreed, for the whole land is laid waste. Suddenly my tents are destroyed, and my curtains gone in a moment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How long will I see the standard and hear the sound of the trumpet?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For my people are foolish. They don’t know me. They are foolish children, and they have no understanding. They are skillful in doing evil, but they don’t know how to do good.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw the earth and, behold, it was waste and void, and the heavens, and they had no light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw the mountains, and behold, they trembled, and all the hills moved back and forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw, and behold, there was no man, and all the birds of the sky had fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw, and behold, the fruitful field was a wilderness, and all its cities were broken down at the presence of Yahweh, before his fierce anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh says, “The whole land will be a desolation; yet I will not make a full end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this the earth will mourn, and the heavens above be black, because I have spoken it. I have planned it, and I have not repented, neither will I turn back from it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every city flees for the noise of the horsemen and archers. They go into the thickets and climb up on the rocks. Every city is forsaken, and not a man dwells therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You, when you are made desolate, what will you do? Though you clothe yourself with scarlet, though you deck yourself with ornaments of gold, though you enlarge your eyes with makeup, you make yourself beautiful in vain. Your lovers despise you. They seek your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have heard a voice as of a woman in travail, the anguish as of her who gives birth to her first child, the voice of the daughter of Zion, who gasps for breath, who spreads her hands, saying, “Woe is me now! For my soul faints before the murderers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Run back and forth through the streets of Jerusalem, and see now, and know, and seek in its wide places, if you can find a man, if there is anyone who does justly, who seeks truth, then I will pardon her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though they say, ‘As Yahweh lives,’ surely they swear falsely.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Yahweh, don’t your eyes look on truth? You have stricken them, but they were not grieved. You have consumed them, but they have refused to receive correction. They have made their faces harder than a rock. They have refused to return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, “Surely these are poor. They are foolish; for they don’t know Yahweh’s way, nor the law of their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will go to the great men and will speak to them, for they know the way of Yahweh, and the law of their God.” But these with one accord have broken the yoke, and burst the bonds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore a lion out of the forest will kill them. A wolf of the evenings will destroy them. A leopard will watch against their cities. Everyone who goes out there will be torn in pieces, because their transgressions are many and their backsliding has increased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How can I pardon you? Your children have forsaken me, and sworn by what are no gods. When I had fed them to the full, they committed adultery, and assembled themselves in troops at the prostitutes’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were as fed horses roaming at large. Everyone neighed after his neighbor’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shouldn’t I punish them for these things?” says Yahweh. “Shouldn’t my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go up on her walls, and destroy, but don’t make a full end. Take away her branches, for they are not Yahweh’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the house of Israel and the house of Judah have dealt very treacherously against me,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have denied Yahweh, and said, “It is not he. Evil won’t come on us. We won’t see sword or famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prophets will become wind, and the word is not in them. Thus it will be done to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Yahweh, the God of Armies says, “Because you speak this word, behold, I will make my words in your mouth fire, and this people wood, and it will devour them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I will bring a nation on you from far away, house of Israel,” says Yahweh. “It is a mighty nation. It is an ancient nation, a nation whose language you don’t know and don’t understand what they say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their quiver is an open tomb. They are all mighty men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will eat up your harvest and your bread, which your sons and your daughters should eat. They will eat up your flocks and your herds. They will eat up your vines and your fig trees. They will beat down your fortified cities in which you trust with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But even in those days,” says Yahweh, “I will not make a full end of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will happen when you say, ‘Why has Yahweh our God done all these things to us?’ Then you shall say to them, ‘Just as you have forsaken me and served foreign gods in your land, so you will serve strangers in a land that is not yours.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Declare this in the house of Jacob, and publish it in Judah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Hear this now, foolish people without understanding, who have eyes, and don’t see, who have ears, and don’t hear:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t you fear me?’ says Yahweh; ‘Won’t you tremble at my presence, who have placed the sand for the bound of the sea by a perpetual decree, that it can’t pass it? Though its waves toss themselves, yet they can’t prevail. Though they roar, they still can’t pass over it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But this people has a revolting and a rebellious heart. They have revolted and gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They don’t say in their heart, ‘Let’s now fear Yahweh our God, who gives rain, both the former and the latter, in its season, who preserves to us the appointed weeks of the harvest.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Your iniquities have turned away these things, and your sins have withheld good from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For wicked men are found among my people. They watch, as fowlers lie in wait. They set a trap. They catch men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a cage is full of birds, so are their houses full of deceit. Therefore they have become great, and grew rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have grown fat. They shine; yes, they excel in deeds of wickedness. They don’t plead the cause, the cause of the fatherless, that they may prosper; and they don’t defend the rights of the needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Shouldn’t I punish for these things?” says Yahweh. “Shouldn’t my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “An astonishing and horrible thing has happened in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prophets prophesy falsely, and the priests rule by their own authority; and my people love to have it so. What will you do in the end of it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Flee for safety, you children of Benjamin, out of the middle of Jerusalem! Blow the trumpet in Tekoa and raise up a signal on Beth Haccherem, for evil looks out from the north with a great destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will cut off the beautiful and delicate one, the daughter of Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shepherds with their flocks will come to her. They will pitch their tents against her all around. They will feed everyone in his place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Prepare war against her! Arise! Let’s go up at noon. Woe to us! For the day declines, for the shadows of the evening are stretched out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arise! Let’s go up by night, and let’s destroy her palaces.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh of Armies said, “Cut down trees, and cast up a mound against Jerusalem. This is the city to be visited. She is filled with oppression within herself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a well produces its waters, so she produces her wickedness. Violence and destruction is heard in her. Sickness and wounds are continually before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be instructed, Jerusalem, lest my soul be alienated from you, lest I make you a desolation, an uninhabited land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh of Armies says, “They will thoroughly glean the remnant of Israel like a vine. Turn again your hand as a grape gatherer into the baskets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To whom should I speak and testify, that they may hear? Behold, their ear is uncircumcised, and they can’t listen. Behold, Yahweh’s word has become a reproach to them. They have no delight in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“For from their least even to their greatest, everyone is given to covetousness.
    From the prophet even to the priest, everyone deals falsely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have healed also the hurt of my people superficially,
    saying, ‘Peace, peace!’ when there is no peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination?
    No, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush.
Therefore they will fall among those who fall.
    When I visit them, they will be cast down,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh says, “Stand in the ways and see, and ask for the old paths, ‘Where is the good way?’ and walk in it, and you will find rest for your souls. But they said, ‘We will not walk in it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I set watchmen over you, saying, ‘Listen to the sound of the trumpet!’ But they said, ‘We will not listen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore hear, you nations, and know, congregation, what is among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear, earth! Behold, I will bring evil on this people, even the fruit of their thoughts, because they have not listened to my words; and as for my law, they have rejected it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To what purpose does frankincense from Sheba come to me, and the sweet cane from a far country? Your burnt offerings are not acceptable, and your sacrifices are not pleasing to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Yahweh says, “Behold, I will lay stumbling blocks before this people. The fathers and the sons together will stumble against them. The neighbor and his friend will perish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh says, “Behold, a people comes from the north country. A great nation will be stirred up from the uttermost parts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They take hold of bow and spear. They are cruel, and have no mercy. Their voice roars like the sea, and they ride on horses, everyone set in array, as a man to the battle, against you, daughter of Zion.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have heard its report. Our hands become feeble. Anguish has taken hold of us, and pains as of a woman in labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t go out into the field or walk by the way; for the sword of the enemy and terror are on every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Daughter of my people, clothe yourself with sackcloth, and wallow in ashes! Mourn, as for an only son, most bitter lamentation, for the destroyer will suddenly come on us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have made you a tester of metals and a fortress among my people, that you may know and try their way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are all grievous rebels, going around to slander. They are bronze and iron. All of them deal corruptly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The bellows blow fiercely. The lead is consumed in the fire. In vain they go on refining, for the wicked are not plucked away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men will call them rejected silver, because Yahweh has rejected them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Stand in the gate of Yahweh’s house, and proclaim this word there, and say, ‘Hear Yahweh’s word, all you of Judah, who enter in at these gates to worship Yahweh.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel says, “Amend your ways and your doings, and I will cause you to dwell in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t trust in lying words, saying, ‘Yahweh’s temple, Yahweh’s temple, Yahweh’s temple, are these.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you thoroughly amend your ways and your doings, if you thoroughly execute justice between a man and his neighbor;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if you don’t oppress the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow, and don’t shed innocent blood in this place, and don’t walk after other gods to your own hurt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will cause you to dwell in this place, in the land that I gave to your fathers, from of old even forever more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, you trust in lying words that can’t profit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will you steal, murder, commit adultery, swear falsely, burn incense to Baal, and walk after other gods that you have not known,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then come and stand before me in this house, which is called by my name, and say, ‘We are delivered,’ that you may do all these abominations?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Has this house, which is called by my name, become a den of robbers in your eyes? Behold, I myself have seen it,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But go now to my place which was in Shiloh, where I caused my name to dwell at the first, and see what I did to it for the wickedness of my people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, because you have done all these works,” says Yahweh, “and I spoke to you, rising up early and speaking, but you didn’t hear; and I called you, but you didn’t answer;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore I will do to the house which is called by my name, in which you trust, and to the place which I gave to you and to your fathers, as I did to Shiloh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will cast you out of my sight, as I have cast out all your brothers, even the whole offspring of Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore don’t pray for this people. Don’t lift up a cry or prayer for them or make intercession to me; for I will not hear you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t you see what they do in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children gather wood, and the fathers kindle the fire, and the women knead the dough, to make cakes to the queen of the sky, and to pour out drink offerings to other gods, that they may provoke me to anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do they provoke me to anger?” says Yahweh. “Don’t they provoke themselves, to the confusion of their own faces?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the Lord Yahweh says: “Behold, my anger and my wrath will be poured out on this place, on man, on animal, on the trees of the field, and on the fruit of the ground; and it will burn and will not be quenched.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel says: “Add your burnt offerings to your sacrifices and eat meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I didn’t speak to your fathers or command them in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt concerning burnt offerings or sacrifices;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but this thing I commanded them, saying, ‘Listen to my voice, and I will be your God, and you shall be my people. Walk in all the way that I command you, that it may be well with you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they didn’t listen or turn their ear, but walked in their own counsels and in the stubbornness of their evil heart, and went backward, and not forward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since the day that your fathers came out of the land of Egypt to this day, I have sent to you all my servants the prophets, daily rising up early and sending them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they didn’t listen to me or incline their ear, but made their neck stiff. They did worse than their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall speak all these words to them, but they will not listen to you. You shall also call to them, but they will not answer you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall tell them, ‘This is the nation that has not listened to Yahweh their God’s voice, nor received instruction. Truth has perished, and is cut off from their mouth.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cut off your hair, and throw it away, and take up a lamentation on the bare heights; for Yahweh has rejected and forsaken the generation of his wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the children of Judah have done that which is evil in my sight,” says Yahweh. “They have set their abominations in the house which is called by my name, to defile it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have built the high places of Topheth, which is in the valley of the son of Hinnom, to burn their sons and their daughters in the fire, which I didn’t command, nor did it come into my mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore behold, the days come”, says Yahweh, “that it will no more be called ‘Topheth’ or ‘The valley of the son of Hinnom’, but ‘The valley of Slaughter’; for they will bury in Topheth until there is no place to bury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The dead bodies of this people will be food for the birds of the sky, and for the animals of the earth. No one will frighten them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will cause to cease from the cities of Judah and from the streets of Jerusalem the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride; for the land will become a waste.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time,” says Yahweh, “they will bring the bones of the kings of Judah, the bones of his princes, the bones of the priests, the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, out of their graves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will spread them before the sun, the moon, and all the army of the sky, which they have loved, which they have served, after which they have walked, which they have sought, and which they have worshiped. They will not be gathered or be buried. They will be like dung on the surface of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Death will be chosen rather than life by all the residue that remain of this evil family, that remain in all the places where I have driven them,” says Yahweh of Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Moreover you shall tell them, ‘Yahweh says:
“‘Do men fall, and not rise up again?
    Does one turn away, and not return?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why then have the people of Jerusalem fallen back by a perpetual backsliding?
    They cling to deceit.
    They refuse to return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I listened and heard, but they didn’t say what is right.
    No one repents of his wickedness, saying, “What have I done?”
Everyone turns to his course,
    as a horse that rushes headlong in the battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“‘How do you say, “We are wise, and Yahweh’s law is with us”?
    But, behold, the false pen of the scribes has made that a lie.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise men are disappointed.
    They are dismayed and trapped.
Behold, they have rejected Yahweh’s word.
    What kind of wisdom is in them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I will give their wives to others
    and their fields to those who will possess them.
For everyone from the least even to the greatest is given to covetousness;
    from the prophet even to the priest everyone deals falsely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have healed the hurt of the daughter of my people slightly, saying,
    “Peace, peace,” when there is no peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination?
    No, they were not at all ashamed.
    They couldn’t blush.
Therefore they will fall among those who fall.
    In the time of their visitation they will be cast down, says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘I will utterly consume them, says Yahweh.
    No grapes will be on the vine,
    no figs on the fig tree,
    and the leaf will fade.
The things that I have given them
    will pass away from them.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Why do we sit still?
    Assemble yourselves!
    Let’s enter into the fortified cities,
    and let’s be silent there;
for Yahweh our God has put us to silence,
    and given us poisoned water to drink,
    because we have sinned against Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We looked for peace, but no good came;
    and for a time of healing, and behold, dismay!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“For, behold, I will send serpents,
    adders among you,
    which will not be charmed;
    and they will bite you,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that I could comfort myself against sorrow!
    My heart is faint within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, the voice of the cry of the daughter of my people from a land that is very far off:
    “Isn’t Yahweh in Zion?
    Isn’t her King in her?” 
“Why have they provoked me to anger with their engraved images,
    and with foreign idols?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The harvest is past.
    The summer has ended,
    and we are not saved.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the hurt of the daughter of my people, I am hurt.
    I mourn.
    Dismay has taken hold of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is there no balm in Gilead?
    Is there no physician there?
Why then isn’t the health of the daughter of my people recovered?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that my head were waters,
    and my eyes a spring of tears,
that I might weep day and night
    for the slain of the daughter of my people!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that I had in the wilderness
    a lodging place of wayfaring men,
that I might leave my people
    and go from them!
For they are all adulterers,
    an assembly of treacherous men.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Friends deceive each other,
    and will not speak the truth.
They have taught their tongue to speak lies.
    They weary themselves committing iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your habitation is in the middle of deceit.
    Through deceit, they refuse to know me,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Their tongue is a deadly arrow.
    It speaks deceit.
One speaks peaceably to his neighbor with his mouth,
    but in his heart, he waits to ambush him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shouldn’t I punish them for these things?” says Yahweh.
    “Shouldn’t my soul be avenged on a nation such as this?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will weep and wail for the mountains,
    and lament for the pastures of the wilderness,
because they are burned up, so that no one passes through;
    Men can’t hear the voice of the livestock.
Both the birds of the sky and the animals have fled.
    They are gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will make Jerusalem heaps,
    a dwelling place of jackals.
I will make the cities of Judah a desolation,
    without inhabitant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is wise enough to understand this? Who is he to whom the mouth of Yahweh has spoken, that he may declare it? Why has the land perished and burned up like a wilderness, so that no one passes through?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh says, “Because they have forsaken my law which I set before them, and have not obeyed my voice or walked in my ways,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but have walked after the stubbornness of their own heart and after the Baals, which their fathers taught them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, says, “Behold, I will feed them, even this people, with wormwood and give them poisoned water to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will scatter them also among the nations, whom neither they nor their fathers have known. I will send the sword after them, until I have consumed them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh of Armies says,
“Consider, and call for the mourning women, that they may come.
    Send for the skillful women, that they may come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them make haste
    and take up a wailing for us,
that our eyes may run down with tears
    and our eyelids gush out with waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a voice of wailing is heard out of Zion,
    ‘How we are ruined!
We are greatly confounded
    because we have forsaken the land,
    because they have cast down our dwellings.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet hear Yahweh’s word, you women.
    Let your ear receive the word of his mouth.
Teach your daughters wailing.
    Everyone teach her neighbor a lamentation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For death has come up into our windows.
    It has entered into our palaces
to cut off the children from outside,
    and the young men from the streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Speak, “Yahweh says,
“‘The dead bodies of men will fall as dung on the open field,
    and as the handful after the harvester.
    No one will gather them.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh says,
“Don’t let the wise man glory in his wisdom.
    Don’t let the mighty man glory in his might.
    Don’t let the rich man glory in his riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But let him who glories glory in this,
    that he has understanding, and knows me,
that I am Yahweh who exercises loving kindness, justice, and righteousness in the earth,
    for I delight in these things,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, the days come,” says Yahweh, “that I will punish all those who are circumcised only in their flesh:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Egypt, Judah, Edom, the children of Ammon, Moab, and all who have the corners of their hair cut off, who dwell in the wilderness, for all the nations are uncircumcised, and all the house of Israel are uncircumcised in heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear the word which Yahweh speaks to you, house of Israel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh says,
“Don’t learn the way of the nations,
    and don’t be dismayed at the signs of the sky;
    for the nations are dismayed at them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They deck it with silver and with gold.
    They fasten it with nails and with hammers,
    so that it can’t move.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are like a palm tree, of turned work,
    and don’t speak.
They must be carried,
    because they can’t move.
Don’t be afraid of them;
    for they can’t do evil,
    neither is it in them to do good.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is no one like you, Yahweh.
    You are great,
    and your name is great in might.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who shouldn’t fear you,
    King of the nations?
    For it belongs to you.
Because among all the wise men of the nations,
    and in all their royal estate,
    there is no one like you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they are together brutish and foolish,
    instructed by idols!
    It is just wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is silver beaten into plates, which is brought from Tarshish,
    and gold from Uphaz,
    the work of the engraver and of the hands of the goldsmith.
Their clothing is blue and purple.
    They are all the work of skillful men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Yahweh is the true God.
    He is the living God,
    and an everlasting King.
At his wrath, the earth trembles.
    The nations aren’t able to withstand his indignation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall say this to them: ‘The gods that have not made the heavens and the earth will perish from the earth, and from under the heavens.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God has made the earth by his power.
    He has established the world by his wisdom,
    and by his understanding has he stretched out the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he utters his voice,
    the waters in the heavens roar,
    and he causes the vapors to ascend from the ends of the earth.
He makes lightnings for the rain,
    and brings the wind out of his treasuries.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They are vanity, a work of delusion.
    In the time of their visitation they will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Gather up your wares out of the land,
    you who live under siege.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Yahweh says,
    “Behold, I will sling out the inhabitants of the land at this time,
    and will distress them, that they may feel it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe is me because of my injury!
    My wound is serious;
but I said,
    “Truly this is my grief, and I must bear it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My tent has been destroyed,
    and all my cords are broken.
My children have gone away from me, and they are no more.
    There is no one to spread my tent any more,
    to set up my curtains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the shepherds have become brutish,
    and have not inquired of Yahweh.
Therefore they have not prospered,
    and all their flocks have scattered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The voice of news, behold, it comes,
    and a great commotion out of the north country,
to make the cities of Judah a desolation,
    a dwelling place of jackals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh, I know that the way of man is not in himself.
    It is not in man who walks to direct his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Pour out your wrath on the nations that don’t know you,
    and on the families that don’t call on your name;
for they have devoured Jacob.
    Yes, they have devoured him, consumed him,
    and have laid waste his habitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hear the words of this covenant, and speak to the men of Judah, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say to them, Yahweh, the God of Israel says: ‘Cursed is the man who doesn’t hear the words of this covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which I commanded your fathers in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt, out of the iron furnace,’ saying, ‘Obey my voice and do them, according to all which I command you; so you shall be my people, and I will be your God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that I may establish the oath which I swore to your fathers, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey,’ as it is today.”
Then I answered, and said, “Amen, Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to me, “Proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying, ‘Hear the words of this covenant, and do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I earnestly protested to your fathers in the day that I brought them up out of the land of Egypt, even to this day, rising early and protesting, saying, “Obey my voice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they didn’t obey, nor turn their ear, but everyone walked in the stubbornness of their evil heart. Therefore I brought on them all the words of this covenant, which I commanded them to do, but they didn’t do them.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to me, “A conspiracy is found among the men of Judah, and among the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have turned back to the iniquities of their forefathers, who refused to hear my words. They have gone after other gods to serve them. The house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken my covenant which I made with their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Yahweh says, ‘Behold, I will bring evil on them which they will not be able to escape; and they will cry to me, but I will not listen to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the cities of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem will go and cry to the gods to which they offer incense, but they will not save them at all in the time of their trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For according to the number of your cities are your gods, Judah; and according to the number of the streets of Jerusalem you have set up altars to the shameful thing, even altars to burn incense to Baal.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore don’t pray for this people. Don’t lift up cry or prayer for them; for I will not hear them in the time that they cry to me because of their trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What has my beloved to do in my house,
    since she has behaved lewdly with many,
    and the holy flesh has passed from you?
When you do evil,
    then you rejoice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh called your name, “A green olive tree,
    beautiful with goodly fruit.”
With the noise of a great roar he has kindled fire on it,
    and its branches are broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh of Armies, who planted you, has pronounced evil against you, because of the evil of the house of Israel and of the house of Judah, which they have done to themselves in provoking me to anger by offering incense to Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh gave me knowledge of it, and I knew it. Then you showed me their doings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I was like a gentle lamb that is led to the slaughter. I didn’t know that they had devised plans against me, saying,
“Let’s destroy the tree with its fruit,
    and let’s cut him off from the land of the living,
    that his name may be no more remembered.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But, Yahweh of Armies, who judges righteously,
    who tests the heart and the mind,
I will see your vengeance on them;
    for to you I have revealed my cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore Yahweh says concerning the men of Anathoth, who seek your life, saying, ‘You shall not prophesy in Yahweh’s name, that you not die by our hand’—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore Yahweh of Armies says, ‘Behold, I will punish them. The young men will die by the sword. Their sons and their daughters will die by famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will be no remnant to them, for I will bring evil on the men of Anathoth, even the year of their visitation.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are righteous, Yahweh,
    when I contend with you;
yet I would like to plead a case with you.
    Why does the way of the wicked prosper?
    Why are they all at ease who deal very treacherously?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have planted them. Yes, they have taken root.
    They grow. Yes, they produce fruit.
You are near in their mouth,
    and far from their heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you, Yahweh, know me.
    You see me, and test my heart toward you.
Pull them out like sheep for the slaughter,
    and prepare them for the day of slaughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will the land mourn,
    and the herbs of the whole country wither?
Because of the wickedness of those who dwell therein,
    the animals and birds are consumed;
because they said,
    “He won’t see our latter end.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If you have run with the footmen,
    and they have wearied you,
    then how can you contend with horses?
Though in a land of peace you are secure,
    yet how will you do in the pride of the Jordan?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For even your brothers, and the house of your father,
    even they have dealt treacherously with you!
    Even they have cried aloud after you!
Don’t believe them,
    though they speak beautiful words to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have forsaken my house.
    I have cast off my heritage.
    I have given the dearly beloved of my soul into the hand of her enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heritage has become to me as a lion in the forest.
    She has uttered her voice against me.
    Therefore I have hated her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is my heritage to me as a speckled bird of prey?
    Are the birds of prey against her all around?
Go, assemble all the animals of the field.
    Bring them to devour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many shepherds have destroyed my vineyard.
    They have trodden my portion under foot.
    They have made my pleasant portion a desolate wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have made it a desolation.
    It mourns to me, being desolate.
The whole land is made desolate,
    because no one cares.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They have sown wheat,
    and have reaped thorns.
They have exhausted themselves,
    and profit nothing.
You will be ashamed of your fruits,
    because of Yahweh’s fierce anger.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh says, “Concerning all my evil neighbors, who touch the inheritance which I have caused my people Israel to inherit: Behold, I will pluck them up from off their land, and will pluck up the house of Judah from among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will happen that after I have plucked them up, I will return and have compassion on them. I will bring them again, every man to his heritage, and every man to his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will happen, if they will diligently learn the ways of my people, to swear by my name, ‘As Yahweh lives;’ even as they taught my people to swear by Baal, then they will be built up in the middle of my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they will not hear, then I will pluck up that nation, plucking up and destroying it,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to me, “Go, and buy yourself a linen belt, and put it on your waist, and don’t put it in water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I bought a belt according to Yahweh’s word, and put it on my waist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came to me the second time, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take the belt that you have bought, which is on your waist, and arise, go to the Euphrates, and hide it there in a cleft of the rock.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I went and hid it by the Euphrates, as Yahweh commanded me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After many days, Yahweh said to me, “Arise, go to the Euphrates, and take the belt from there, which I commanded you to hide there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I went to the Euphrates, and dug, and took the belt from the place where I had hidden it; and behold, the belt was ruined. It was profitable for nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yahweh says, ‘In this way I will ruin the pride of Judah, and the great pride of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This evil people, who refuse to hear my words, who walk in the stubbornness of their heart, and have gone after other gods to serve them and to worship them, will even be as this belt, which is profitable for nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the belt clings to the waist of a man, so I have caused the whole house of Israel and the whole house of Judah to cling to me,’ says Yahweh; ‘that they may be to me for a people, for a name, for praise, and for glory; but they would not hear.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore you shall speak to them this word: ‘Yahweh, the God of Israel says, “Every container should be filled with wine.”’ They will tell you, ‘Do we not certainly know that every container should be filled with wine?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then tell them, ‘Yahweh says, “Behold, I will fill all the inhabitants of this land, even the kings who sit on David’s throne, the priests, the prophets, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, with drunkenness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will dash them one against another, even the fathers and the sons together,” says Yahweh: “I will not pity, spare, or have compassion, that I should not destroy them.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, and give ear.
    Don’t be proud,
    for Yahweh has spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give glory to Yahweh your God,
    before he causes darkness,
    and before your feet stumble on the dark mountains,
and while you look for light,
    he turns it into the shadow of death,
    and makes it deep darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But if you will not hear it,
    my soul will weep in secret for your pride.
My eye will weep bitterly,
    and run down with tears,
    because Yahweh’s flock has been taken captive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say to the king and to the queen mother,
    “Humble yourselves.
Sit down, for your crowns have come down,
    even the crown of your glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The cities of the South are shut up,
    and there is no one to open them.
Judah is carried away captive: all of them.
    They are wholly carried away captive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lift up your eyes,
    and see those who come from the north.
Where is the flock that was given to you,
    your beautiful flock?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What will you say when he sets over you as head those whom you have yourself taught to be friends to you?
    Won’t sorrows take hold of you, as of a woman in travail?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you say in your heart,
    “Why have these things come on me?”
Your skirts are uncovered because of the greatness of your iniquity,
    and your heels suffer violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can the Ethiopian change his skin,
    or the leopard his spots?
Then may you also do good,
    who are accustomed to do evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore I will scatter them
    as the stubble that passes away
    by the wind of the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is your lot,
    the portion measured to you from me,” says Yahweh,
“because you have forgotten me,
    and trusted in falsehood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I will also uncover your skirts on your face,
    and your shame will appear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have seen your abominations, even your adulteries
    and your neighing, the lewdness of your prostitution,
    on the hills in the field.
Woe to you, Jerusalem!
    You will not be made clean.
    How long will it yet be?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is Yahweh’s word that came to Jeremiah concerning the drought:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Judah mourns,
    and its gates languish.
They sit in black on the ground.
    The cry of Jerusalem goes up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their nobles send their little ones to the waters.
    They come to the cisterns,
    and find no water.
They return with their vessels empty.
    They are disappointed and confounded,
    and cover their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of the ground which is cracked,
    because no rain has been in the land,
the plowmen are disappointed.
    They cover their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, the doe in the field also calves and forsakes her young,
    because there is no grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wild donkeys stand on the bare heights.
    They pant for air like jackals.
Their eyes fail,
    because there is no vegetation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though our iniquities testify against us,
    work for your name’s sake, Yahweh;
for our rebellions are many.
    We have sinned against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You hope of Israel,
    its Savior in the time of trouble,
why should you be as a foreigner in the land,
    and as a wayfaring man who turns aside to stay for a night?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should you be like a scared man,
    as a mighty man who can’t save?
Yet you, Yahweh, are in the middle of us,
    and we are called by your name.
    Don’t leave us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh says to this people:
“Even so they have loved to wander.
    They have not restrained their feet.
Therefore Yahweh does not accept them.
    Now he will remember their iniquity,
    and punish them for their sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to me, “Don’t pray for this people for their good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they fast, I will not hear their cry; and when they offer burnt offering and meal offering, I will not accept them; but I will consume them by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, “Ah, Lord Yahweh! Behold, the prophets tell them, ‘You will not see the sword, neither will you have famine; but I will give you assured peace in this place.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh said to me, “The prophets prophesy lies in my name. I didn’t send them. I didn’t command them. I didn’t speak to them. They prophesy to you a lying vision, divination, and a thing of nothing, and the deceit of their own heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Yahweh says concerning the prophets who prophesy in my name, but I didn’t send them, yet they say, ‘Sword and famine will not be in this land.’ Those prophets will be consumed by sword and famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people to whom they prophesy will be cast out in the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and the sword. They will have no one to bury them—them, their wives, their sons, or their daughters, for I will pour their wickedness on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
If I go out into the field,
    then behold, the slain with the sword!
If I enter into the city,
    then behold, those who are sick with famine!
For both the prophet and the priest go about in the land,
    and have no knowledge.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you utterly rejected Judah?
    Has your soul loathed Zion?
Why have you struck us, and there is no healing for us?
    We looked for peace, but no good came;
    and for a time of healing, and behold, dismay!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do not abhor us, for your name’s sake.
    Do not disgrace the throne of your glory.
    Remember, and don’t break your covenant with us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Are there any among the vanities of the nations that can cause rain?
    Or can the sky give showers?
    Aren’t you he, Yahweh our God?
Therefore we will wait for you;
    for you have made all these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh said to me, “Though Moses and Samuel stood before me, yet my mind would not turn toward this people. Cast them out of my sight, and let them go out!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: “I will appoint over them four kinds,” says Yahweh: “the sword to kill, the dogs to tear, the birds of the sky, and the animals of the earth, to devour and to destroy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will cause them to be tossed back and forth among all the kingdoms of the earth, because of Manasseh, the son of Hezekiah, king of Judah, for that which he did in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For who will have pity on you, Jerusalem?
    Who will mourn you?
    Who will come to ask of your welfare?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have rejected me,” says Yahweh.
    “You have gone backward.
Therefore I have stretched out my hand against you
    and destroyed you.
    I am weary of showing compassion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have winnowed them with a fan in the gates of the land.
    I have bereaved them of children.
I have destroyed my people.
    They didn’t return from their ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their widows are increased more than the sand of the seas.
    I have brought on them against the mother of the young men a destroyer at noonday.
    I have caused anguish and terrors to fall on her suddenly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She who has borne seven languishes.
    She has given up the spirit.
Her sun has gone down while it was yet day.
    She has been disappointed and confounded.
    I will deliver their residue to the sword before their enemies,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe is me, my mother, that you have borne me, a man of strife,
    and a man of contention to the whole earth!
I have not lent, neither have men lent to me;
    yet every one of them curses me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh said,
“Most certainly I will strengthen you for good.
    Most certainly I will cause the enemy to make supplication to you in the time of evil
    and in the time of affliction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can one break iron,
    even iron from the north, and bronze?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give your substance and your treasures for a plunder without price,
    and that for all your sins,
    even in all your borders.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh, you know.
    Remember me, visit me,
    and avenge me of my persecutors.
You are patient, so don’t take me away.
    Know that for your sake I have suffered reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your words were found,
    and I ate them.
Your words were to me a joy and the rejoicing of my heart,
    for I am called by your name, Yahweh, God of Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I didn’t sit in the assembly of those who make merry and rejoice.
    I sat alone because of your hand,
    for you have filled me with indignation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why is my pain perpetual,
    and my wound incurable,
    which refuses to be healed?
Will you indeed be to me as a deceitful brook,
    like waters that fail?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore Yahweh says,
“If you return, then I will bring you again,
    that you may stand before me;
and if you take out the precious from the vile,
    you will be as my mouth.
They will return to you,
    but you will not return to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make you to this people a fortified bronze wall.
    They will fight against you,
    but they will not prevail against you;
for I am with you to save you
    and to deliver you,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will deliver you out of the hand of the wicked,
    and I will redeem you out of the hand of the terrible.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not take a wife, neither shall you have sons or daughters, in this place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh says concerning the sons and concerning the daughters who are born in this place, and concerning their mothers who bore them, and concerning their fathers who became their father in this land:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They will die grievous deaths. They will not be lamented, neither will they be buried. They will be as dung on the surface of the ground. They will be consumed by the sword and by famine. Their dead bodies will be food for the birds of the sky and for the animals of the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh says, “Don’t enter into the house of mourning. Don’t go to lament. Don’t bemoan them, for I have taken away my peace from this people,” says Yahweh, “even loving kindness and tender mercies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Both great and small will die in this land. They will not be buried. Men won’t lament for them, cut themselves, or make themselves bald for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men won’t break bread for them in mourning, to comfort them for the dead. Men won’t give them the cup of consolation to drink for their father or for their mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not go into the house of feasting to sit with them, to eat and to drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel says: “Behold, I will cause to cease out of this place, before your eyes and in your days, the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will happen, when you tell this people all these words, and they ask you, ‘Why has Yahweh pronounced all this great evil against us?’ or ‘What is our iniquity?’ or ‘What is our sin that we have committed against Yahweh our God?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall tell them, ‘Because your fathers have forsaken me,’ says Yahweh, ‘and have walked after other gods, have served them, have worshiped them, have forsaken me, and have not kept my law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have done evil more than your fathers, for behold, you each walk after the stubbornness of his evil heart, so that you don’t listen to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I will cast you out of this land into the land that you have not known, neither you nor your fathers. There you will serve other gods day and night, for I will show you no favor.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore behold, the days come,” says Yahweh, “that it will no more be said, ‘As Yahweh lives, who brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt;’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but, ‘As Yahweh lives, who brought up the children of Israel from the land of the north, and from all the countries where he had driven them.’ I will bring them again into their land that I gave to their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, I will send for many fishermen,” says Yahweh, “and they will fish them up. Afterward I will send for many hunters, and they will hunt them from every mountain, from every hill, and out of the clefts of the rocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For my eyes are on all their ways. They are not hidden from my face. Their iniquity isn’t concealed from my eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: First I will recompense their iniquity and their sin double, because they have polluted my land with the carcasses of their detestable things, and have filled my inheritance with their abominations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh, my strength, my stronghold,
    and my refuge in the day of affliction,
the nations will come to you from the ends of the earth,
    and will say,
“Our fathers have inherited nothing but lies,
    vanity and things in which there is no profit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should a man make to himself gods
    which yet are no gods?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore behold, I will cause them to know,
    this once I will cause them to know my hand and my might.
    Then they will know that my name is Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The sin of Judah is written with a pen of iron,
    and with the point of a diamond.
It is engraved on the tablet of their heart,
    and on the horns of your altars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even their children remember their altars
    and their Asherah poles by the green trees on the high hills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mountain in the field,
    I will give your substance and all your treasures for a plunder,
    and your high places, because of sin, throughout all your borders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You, even of yourself, will discontinue from your heritage that I gave you.
    I will cause you to serve your enemies in the land which you don’t know,
    for you have kindled a fire in my anger which will burn forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh says:
“Cursed is the man who trusts in man,
    relies on strength of flesh,
    and whose heart departs from Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he will be like a bush in the desert,
    and will not see when good comes,
but will inhabit the parched places in the wilderness,
    an uninhabited salt land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Blessed is the man who trusts in Yahweh,
    and whose confidence is in Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he will be as a tree planted by the waters,
    who spreads out its roots by the river,
and will not fear when heat comes,
    but its leaf will be green,
and will not be concerned in the year of drought.
    It won’t cease from yielding fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart is deceitful above all things
    and it is exceedingly corrupt.
    Who can know it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I, Yahweh, search the mind.
    I try the heart,
even to give every man according to his ways,
    according to the fruit of his doings.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As the partridge that sits on eggs which she has not laid,
    so is he who gets riches, and not by right.
In the middle of his days, they will leave him.
    At his end, he will be a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A glorious throne, set on high from the beginning,
    is the place of our sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh, the hope of Israel,
    all who forsake you will be disappointed.
Those who depart from me will be written in the earth,
    because they have forsaken Yahweh,
    the spring of living waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, they ask me,
    “Where is Yahweh’s word?
    Let it be fulfilled now.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for me, I have not hurried from being a shepherd after you.
    I haven’t desired the woeful day. You know.
    That which came out of my lips was before your face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Don’t be a terror to me.
    You are my refuge in the day of evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be disappointed who persecute me,
    but don’t let me be disappointed.
Let them be dismayed,
    but don’t let me be dismayed.
Bring on them the day of evil,
    and destroy them with double destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said this to me: “Go and stand in the gate of the children of the people, through which the kings of Judah come in and by which they go out, and in all the gates of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell them, ‘Hear Yahweh’s word, you kings of Judah, all Judah, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, that enter in by these gates:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh says, “Be careful, and bear no burden on the Sabbath day, nor bring it in by the gates of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator
