verses.text: Don’t carry a burden out of your houses on the Sabbath day. Don’t do any work, but make the Sabbath day holy, as I commanded your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they didn’t listen. They didn’t turn their ear, but made their neck stiff, that they might not hear, and might not receive instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will happen, if you diligently listen to me,” says Yahweh, “to bring in no burden through the gates of this city on the Sabbath day, but to make the Sabbath day holy, to do no work therein;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then there will enter in by the gates of this city kings and princes sitting on David’s throne, riding in chariots and on horses, they and their princes, the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem; and this city will remain forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will come from the cities of Judah, and from the places around Jerusalem, from the land of Benjamin, from the lowland, from the hill country, and from the South, bringing burnt offerings, sacrifices, meal offerings, and frankincense, and bringing sacrifices of thanksgiving to Yahweh’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you will not listen to me to make the Sabbath day holy, and not to bear a burden and enter in at the gates of Jerusalem on the Sabbath day, then I will kindle a fire in its gates, and it will devour the palaces of Jerusalem. It will not be quenched.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word which came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Arise, and go down to the potter’s house, and there I will cause you to hear my words.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I went down to the potter’s house, and behold, he was making something on the wheels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the vessel that he made of the clay was marred in the hand of the potter, he made it again another vessel, as seemed good to the potter to make it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “House of Israel, can’t I do with you as this potter?” says Yahweh. “Behold, as the clay in the potter’s hand, so are you in my hand, house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the instant I speak concerning a nation, and concerning a kingdom, to pluck up and to break down and to destroy it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if that nation, concerning which I have spoken, turns from their evil, I will repent of the evil that I thought to do to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the instant I speak concerning a nation, and concerning a kingdom, to build and to plant it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if they do that which is evil in my sight, that they not obey my voice, then I will repent of the good with which I said I would benefit them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now therefore, speak to the men of Judah, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, saying, ‘Yahweh says: “Behold, I frame evil against you, and devise a plan against you. Everyone return from his evil way now, and amend your ways and your doings.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they say, ‘It is in vain; for we will walk after our own plans, and we will each follow the stubbornness of his evil heart.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore Yahweh says:
“Ask now among the nations,
    ‘Who has heard such things?’
    The virgin of Israel has done a very horrible thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will the snow of Lebanon fail from the rock of the field?
    Will the cold waters that flow down from afar be dried up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my people have forgotten me.
    They have burned incense to false gods.
They have been made to stumble in their ways
    in the ancient paths,
    to walk in byways, in a way not built up,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to make their land an astonishment,
    and a perpetual hissing.
Everyone who passes by it will be astonished,
    and shake his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will scatter them as with an east wind before the enemy.
    I will show them the back, and not the face,
    in the day of their calamity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said, “Come! Let’s devise plans against Jeremiah; for the law won’t perish from the priest, nor counsel from the wise, nor the word from the prophet. Come, and let’s strike him with the tongue, and let’s not give heed to any of his words.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give heed to me, Yahweh,
    and listen to the voice of those who contend with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should evil be recompensed for good?
    For they have dug a pit for my soul.
Remember how I stood before you to speak good for them,
    to turn away your wrath from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore deliver up their children to the famine,
    and give them over to the power of the sword.
Let their wives become childless and widows.
    Let their men be killed
    and their young men struck by the sword in battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let a cry be heard from their houses
    when you bring a troop suddenly on them;
for they have dug a pit to take me
    and hidden snares for my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet, Yahweh, you know all their counsel against me to kill me.
    Don’t forgive their iniquity.
    Don’t blot out their sin from your sight,
Let them be overthrown before you.
    Deal with them in the time of your anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus said Yahweh, “Go, and buy a potter’s earthen container, and take some of the elders of the people and of the elders of the priests;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and go out to the valley of the son of Hinnom, which is by the entry of the gate Harsith, and proclaim there the words that I will tell you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say, ‘Hear Yahweh’s word, kings of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem: Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel says, “Behold, I will bring evil on this place, which whoever hears, his ears will tingle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because they have forsaken me, and have defiled this place, and have burned incense in it to other gods that they didn’t know—they, their fathers, and the kings of Judah—and have filled this place with the blood of innocents,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and have built the high places of Baal to burn their children in the fire for burnt offerings to Baal, which I didn’t command, nor speak, which didn’t even enter into my mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, behold, the days come,” says Yahweh, “that this place will no more be called ‘Topheth’, nor ‘The Valley of the son of Hinnom’, but ‘The valley of Slaughter’.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“I will make the counsel of Judah and Jerusalem void in this place. I will cause them to fall by the sword before their enemies, and by the hand of those who seek their life. I will give their dead bodies to be food for the birds of the sky and for the animals of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make this city an astonishment and a hissing. Everyone who passes by it will be astonished and hiss because of all its plagues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will cause them to eat the flesh of their sons and the flesh of their daughters. They will each eat the flesh of his friend in the siege and in the distress with which their enemies, and those who seek their life, will distress them.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you shall break the container in the sight of the men who go with you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and shall tell them, ‘Yahweh of Armies says: “Even so I will break this people and this city as one breaks a potter’s vessel, that can’t be made whole again. They will bury in Topheth until there is no place to bury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what I will do to this place,” says Yahweh, “and to its inhabitants, even making this city as Topheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The houses of Jerusalem and the houses of the kings of Judah, which are defiled, will be as the place of Topheth, even all the houses on whose roofs they have burned incense to all the army of the sky and have poured out drink offerings to other gods.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah came from Topheth, where Yahweh had sent him to prophesy, and he stood in the court of Yahweh’s house, and said to all the people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel says, ‘Behold, I will bring on this city and on all its towns all the evil that I have pronounced against it, because they have made their neck stiff, that they may not hear my words.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Pashhur, the son of Immer the priest, who was chief officer in Yahweh’s house, heard Jeremiah prophesying these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pashhur struck Jeremiah the prophet and put him in the stocks that were in the upper gate of Benjamin, which was in Yahweh’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day, Pashhur released Jeremiah out of the stocks. Then Jeremiah said to him, “Yahweh has not called your name Pashhur, but Magormissabib.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh says, ‘Behold, I will make you a terror to yourself and to all your friends. They will fall by the sword of their enemies, and your eyes will see it. I will give all Judah into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he will carry them captive to Babylon, and will kill them with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover I will give all the riches of this city, and all its gains, and all its precious things, yes, I will give all the treasures of the kings of Judah into the hand of their enemies. They will make them captives, take them, and carry them to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You, Pashhur, and all who dwell in your house will go into captivity. You will come to Babylon, and there you will die, and there you will be buried, you, and all your friends, to whom you have prophesied falsely.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh, you have persuaded me, and I was persuaded.
    You are stronger than I, and have prevailed.
I have become a laughingstock all day.
    Everyone mocks me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For as often as I speak, I cry out;
    I cry, “Violence and destruction!”
because Yahweh’s word has been made a reproach to me,
    and a derision, all day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I say that I will not make mention of him,
    or speak any more in his name,
then there is in my heart as it were a burning fire shut up in my bones.
    I am weary with holding it in.
    I can’t.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I have heard the defaming of many:
    “Terror on every side!
    Denounce, and we will denounce him!”
say all my familiar friends,
    those who watch for my fall.
“Perhaps he will be persuaded,
    and we will prevail against him,
    and we will take our revenge on him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Yahweh is with me as an awesome mighty one.
    Therefore my persecutors will stumble,
    and they won’t prevail.
They will be utterly disappointed
    because they have not dealt wisely,
    even with an everlasting dishonor which will never be forgotten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Yahweh of Armies, who tests the righteous,
    who sees the heart and the mind,
let me see your vengeance on them,
    for I have revealed my cause to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to Yahweh!
    Praise Yahweh,
    for he has delivered the soul of the needy from the hand of evildoers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cursed is the day in which I was born.
    Don’t let the day in which my mother bore me be blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cursed is the man who brought news to my father, saying,
    “A boy is born to you,” making him very glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let that man be as the cities which Yahweh overthrew,
    and didn’t repent.
Let him hear a cry in the morning,
    and shouting at noontime,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because he didn’t kill me from the womb.
    So my mother would have been my grave,
    and her womb always great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why did I come out of the womb to see labor and sorrow,
    that my days should be consumed with shame?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word which came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, when King Zedekiah sent to him Pashhur the son of Malchijah, and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah, the priest, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Please inquire of Yahweh for us; for Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon makes war against us. Perhaps Yahweh will deal with us according to all his wondrous works, that he may withdraw from us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah said to them, “Tell Zedekiah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Yahweh, the God of Israel says, “Behold, I will turn back the weapons of war that are in your hands, with which you fight against the king of Babylon, and against the Chaldeans who besiege you outside the walls; and I will gather them into the middle of this city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I myself will fight against you with an outstretched hand and with a strong arm, even in anger, in wrath, and in great indignation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will strike the inhabitants of this city, both man and animal. They will die of a great pestilence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward,” says Yahweh, “I will deliver Zedekiah king of Judah, his servants, and the people, even those who are left in this city from the pestilence, from the sword, and from the famine, into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of those who seek their life. He will strike them with the edge of the sword. He will not spare them, have pity, or have mercy.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall say to this people, ‘Yahweh says: “Behold, I set before you the way of life and the way of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who remains in this city will die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, but he who goes out and passes over to the Chaldeans who besiege you, he will live, and he will escape with his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have set my face on this city for evil, and not for good,” says Yahweh. “It will be given into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he will burn it with fire.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Concerning the house of the king of Judah, hear Yahweh’s word:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
House of David, Yahweh says,
‘Execute justice in the morning,
    and deliver him who is robbed out of the hand of the oppressor,
lest my wrath go out like fire,
    and burn so that no one can quench it,
    because of the evil of your doings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I am against you, O inhabitant of the valley,
    and of the rock of the plain,’ says Yahweh.
‘You that say, “Who would come down against us?”
    or, “Who would enter into our homes?”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said, “Go down to the house of the king of Judah, and speak this word there:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Hear Yahweh’s word, king of Judah, who sits on David’s throne—you, your servants, and your people who enter in by these gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh says: “Execute justice and righteousness, and deliver him who is robbed out of the hand of the oppressor. Do no wrong. Do no violence to the foreigner, the fatherless, or the widow. Don’t shed innocent blood in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you do this thing indeed, then kings sitting on David’s throne will enter in by the gates of this house, riding in chariots and on horses—they, their servants, and their people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you will not hear these words, I swear by myself,” says Yahweh, “that this house will become a desolation.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Yahweh says concerning the house of the king of Judah:
“You are Gilead to me,
    the head of Lebanon.
Yet surely I will make you a wilderness,
    cities which are not inhabited.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will prepare destroyers against you,
    everyone with his weapons,
and they will cut down your choice cedars,
    and cast them into the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Many nations will pass by this city, and they will each ask his neighbor, ‘Why has Yahweh done this to this great city?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will answer, ‘Because they abandoned the covenant of Yahweh their God, worshiped other gods, and served them.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh says touching Shallum the son of Josiah, king of Judah, who reigned instead of Josiah his father, and who went out of this place: “He won’t return there any more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he will die in the place where they have led him captive. He will see this land no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
who says, ‘I will build myself a wide house and spacious rooms,’
    and cuts out windows for himself,
with a cedar ceiling,
    and painted with red.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Should you reign because you strive to excel in cedar?
    Didn’t your father eat and drink,
    and do justice and righteousness?
    Then it was well with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He judged the cause of the poor and needy;
    so then it was well.
Wasn’t this to know me?”
    says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore Yahweh says concerning Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah:
“They won’t lament for him,
    saying, ‘Ah my brother!’ or, ‘Ah sister!’
They won’t lament for him,
    saying ‘Ah lord!’ or, ‘Ah his glory!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will be buried with the burial of a donkey,
    drawn and cast out beyond the gates of Jerusalem.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Go up to Lebanon, and cry out.
    Lift up your voice in Bashan,
and cry from Abarim;
    for all your lovers have been destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I spoke to you in your prosperity,
    but you said, ‘I will not listen.’
This has been your way from your youth,
    that you didn’t obey my voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wind will feed all your shepherds,
    and your lovers will go into captivity.
Surely then you will be ashamed
    and confounded for all your wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Inhabitant of Lebanon,
    who makes your nest in the cedars,
how greatly to be pitied you will be when pangs come on you,
    the pain as of a woman in travail!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As I live,” says Yahweh, “though Coniah the son of Jehoiakim king of Judah were the signet on my right hand, I would still pluck you from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I would give you into the hand of those who seek your life, and into the hand of them of whom you are afraid, even into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of the Chaldeans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will cast you out with your mother who bore you into another country, where you were not born; and there you will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to the land to which their soul longs to return, there they will not return.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is this man Coniah a despised broken vessel?
    Is he a vessel in which no one delights?
Why are they cast out, he and his offspring,
    and cast into a land which they don’t know?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O earth, earth, earth,
    hear Yahweh’s word!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to the shepherds who destroy and scatter the sheep of my pasture!” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Yahweh, the God of Israel, says against the shepherds who feed my people: “You have scattered my flock, driven them away, and have not visited them. Behold, I will visit on you the evil of your doings,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will gather the remnant of my flock out of all the countries where I have driven them, and will bring them again to their folds; and they will be fruitful and multiply.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will set up shepherds over them who will feed them. They will no longer be afraid or dismayed, neither will any be lacking,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, the days come,” says Yahweh,
    “that I will raise to David a righteous Branch;
and he will reign as king and deal wisely,
    and will execute justice and righteousness in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In his days Judah will be saved,
    and Israel will dwell safely.
This is his name by which he will be called:
    Yahweh our righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, behold, the days come,” says Yahweh, “that they will no more say, ‘As Yahweh lives, who brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt;’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but, ‘As Yahweh lives, who brought up and who led the offspring of the house of Israel out of the north country, and from all the countries where I had driven them.’ Then they will dwell in their own land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Concerning the prophets:
My heart within me is broken.
    All my bones shake.
I am like a drunken man,
    and like a man whom wine has overcome,
because of Yahweh,
    and because of his holy words.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
for both prophet and priest are profane.
    Yes, in my house I have found their wickedness,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“I have seen folly in the prophets of Samaria.
    They prophesied by Baal,
    and caused my people Israel to err.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the prophets of Jerusalem I have also seen a horrible thing:
    they commit adultery and walk in lies.
They strengthen the hands of evildoers,
    so that no one returns from his wickedness.
They have all become to me as Sodom,
    and its inhabitants as Gomorrah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore Yahweh of Armies says concerning the prophets:
“Behold, I will feed them with wormwood,
    and make them drink poisoned water;
    for from the prophets of Jerusalem ungodliness has gone out into all the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh of Armies says,
“Don’t listen to the words of the prophets who prophesy to you.
    They teach you vanity.
    They speak a vision of their own heart,
    and not out of the mouth of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They say continually to those who despise me,
    ‘Yahweh has said, “You will have peace;”’
and to everyone who walks in the stubbornness of his own heart they say,
    ‘No evil will come on you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For who has stood in the council of Yahweh,
    that he should perceive and hear his word?
    Who has listened to my word, and heard it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, Yahweh’s storm, his wrath, has gone out.
    Yes, a whirling storm!
    It will burst on the head of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh’s anger will not return until he has executed
    and performed the intents of his heart.
    In the latter days, you will understand it perfectly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I didn’t send these prophets, yet they ran.
    I didn’t speak to them, yet they prophesied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But if they had stood in my council,
    then they would have caused my people to hear my words,
and would have turned them from their evil way,
    and from the evil of their doings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Am I a God at hand,” says Yahweh,
    “and not a God afar off?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can anyone hide himself in secret places
    so that I can’t see him?” says Yahweh.
    “Don’t I fill heaven and earth?” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have heard what the prophets have said, who prophesy lies in my name, saying, ‘I had a dream! I had a dream!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How long will this be in the heart of the prophets who prophesy lies, even the prophets of the deceit of their own heart?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They intend to cause my people to forget my name by their dreams which they each tell his neighbor, as their fathers forgot my name because of Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prophet who has a dream, let him tell a dream; and he who has my word, let him speak my word faithfully. What is the straw to the wheat?” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Isn’t my word like fire?” says Yahweh; “and like a hammer that breaks the rock in pieces?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore behold, I am against the prophets,” says Yahweh, “who each steal my words from his neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I am against the prophets,” says Yahweh, “who use their tongues, and say, ‘He says.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I am against those who prophesy lying dreams,” says Yahweh, “who tell them, and cause my people to err by their lies, and by their vain boasting; yet I didn’t send them or command them. They don’t profit this people at all,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When this people, or the prophet, or a priest, asks you, saying, ‘What is the message from Yahweh?’ Then you shall tell them, ‘“What message? I will cast you off,” says Yahweh.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the prophet, the priest, and the people, who say, ‘The message from Yahweh,’ I will even punish that man and his household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will say everyone to his neighbor, and everyone to his brother, ‘What has Yahweh answered?’ and, ‘What has Yahweh said?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will mention the message from Yahweh no more, for every man’s own word has become his message; for you have perverted the words of the living God, of Yahweh of Armies, our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will say to the prophet, ‘What has Yahweh answered you?’ and, ‘What has Yahweh spoken?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although you say, ‘The message from Yahweh,’ therefore Yahweh says: ‘Because you say this word, “The message from Yahweh,” and I have sent to you, telling you not to say, “The message from Yahweh,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore behold, I will utterly forget you, and I will cast you off with the city that I gave to you and to your fathers, away from my presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring an everlasting reproach on you, and a perpetual shame, which will not be forgotten.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh showed me, and behold, two baskets of figs were set before Yahweh’s temple, after Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, and the princes of Judah, with the craftsmen and smiths, from Jerusalem, and had brought them to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One basket had very good figs, like the figs that are first-ripe; and the other basket had very bad figs, which could not be eaten, they were so bad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Yahweh asked me, “What do you see, Jeremiah?”
I said, “Figs. The good figs are very good, and the bad are very bad, so bad that they can’t be eaten.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yahweh, the God of Israel says: ‘Like these good figs, so I will regard the captives of Judah, whom I have sent out of this place into the land of the Chaldeans, as good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will set my eyes on them for good, and I will bring them again to this land. I will build them, and not pull them down. I will plant them, and not pluck them up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give them a heart to know me, that I am Yahweh. They will be my people, and I will be their God; for they will return to me with their whole heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘As the bad figs, which can’t be eaten, they are so bad,’ surely Yahweh says, ‘So I will give up Zedekiah the king of Judah, and his princes, and the remnant of Jerusalem who remain in this land, and those who dwell in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will even give them up to be tossed back and forth among all the kingdoms of the earth for evil, to be a reproach and a proverb, a taunt and a curse, in all places where I will drive them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will send the sword, the famine, and the pestilence among them, until they are consumed from off the land that I gave to them and to their fathers.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah (this was the first year of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which Jeremiah the prophet spoke to all the people of Judah, and to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the thirteenth year of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah, even to this day, these twenty-three years, Yahweh’s word has come to me, and I have spoken to you, rising up early and speaking; but you have not listened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh has sent to you all his servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them (but you have not listened or inclined your ear to hear),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Return now everyone from his evil way, and from the evil of your doings, and dwell in the land that Yahweh has given to you and to your fathers, from of old and even forever more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t go after other gods to serve them or worship them, and don’t provoke me to anger with the work of your hands; then I will do you no harm.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yet you have not listened to me,” says Yahweh, “that you may provoke me to anger with the work of your hands to your own hurt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Yahweh of Armies says: “Because you have not heard my words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: behold, I will send and take all the families of the north,” says Yahweh, “and I will send to Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, my servant, and will bring them against this land, and against its inhabitants, and against all these nations around. I will utterly destroy them, and make them an astonishment, and a hissing, and perpetual desolations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover I will take from them the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the sound of the millstones, and the light of the lamp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This whole land will be a desolation, and an astonishment; and these nations will serve the king of Babylon seventy years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It will happen, when seventy years are accomplished, that I will punish the king of Babylon and that nation,” says Yahweh, “for their iniquity. I will make the land of the Chaldeans desolate forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring on that land all my words which I have pronounced against it, even all that is written in this book, which Jeremiah has prophesied against all the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For many nations and great kings will make bondservants of them, even of them. I will recompense them according to their deeds, and according to the work of their hands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh, the God of Israel, says to me: “Take this cup of the wine of wrath from my hand, and cause all the nations to whom I send you to drink it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will drink, and reel back and forth, and be insane, because of the sword that I will send among them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I took the cup at Yahweh’s hand, and made all the nations to drink, to whom Yahweh had sent me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jerusalem, and the cities of Judah, with its kings and its princes, to make them a desolation, an astonishment, a hissing, and a curse, as it is today;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh king of Egypt, with his servants, his princes, and all his people;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the mixed people, and all the kings of the land of Uz, all the kings of the Philistines, Ashkelon, Gaza, Ekron, and the remnant of Ashdod;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Edom, Moab, and the children of Ammon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the kings of Tyre, all the kings of Sidon, and the kings of the isle which is beyond the sea;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dedan, Tema, Buz, and all who have the corners of their beard cut off;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the kings of Arabia, all the kings of the mixed people who dwell in the wilderness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the kings of Zimri, all the kings of Elam, and all the kings of the Medes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the kings of the north, far and near, one with another; and all the kingdoms of the world, which are on the surface of the earth. The king of Sheshach will drink after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall tell them, ‘Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel says: “Drink, and be drunk, vomit, fall, and rise no more, because of the sword which I will send among you.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be, if they refuse to take the cup at your hand to drink, then you shall tell them, ‘Yahweh of Armies says: “You shall surely drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For, behold, I begin to work evil at the city which is called by my name; and should you be utterly unpunished? You will not be unpunished; for I will call for a sword on all the inhabitants of the earth, says Yahweh of Armies.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore prophesy against them all these words, and tell them,
“‘Yahweh will roar from on high,
    and utter his voice from his holy habitation.
    He will mightily roar against his fold.
He will give a shout, as those who tread grapes,
    against all the inhabitants of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A noise will come even to the end of the earth;
    for Yahweh has a controversy with the nations.
He will enter into judgment with all flesh.
    As for the wicked, he will give them to the sword,”’ says Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh of Armies says,
“Behold, evil will go out from nation to nation,
    and a great storm will be raised up from the uttermost parts of the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The slain of Yahweh will be at that day from one end of the earth even to the other end of the earth. They won’t be lamented. They won’t be gathered or buried. They will be dung on the surface of the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The shepherds will have no way to flee.
    The leader of the flock will have no escape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A voice of the cry of the shepherds,
    and the wailing of the leader of the flock,
    for Yahweh destroys their pasture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The peaceful folds are brought to silence
    because of the fierce anger of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came from Yahweh:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yahweh says: ‘Stand in the court of Yahweh’s house, and speak to all the cities of Judah which come to worship in Yahweh’s house, all the words that I command you to speak to them. Don’t omit a word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It may be they will listen, and every man turn from his evil way, that I may relent from the evil which I intend to do to them because of the evil of their doings.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall tell them, “Yahweh says: ‘If you will not listen to me, to walk in my law which I have set before you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to listen to the words of my servants the prophets whom I send to you, even rising up early and sending them—but you have not listened—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will make this house like Shiloh, and will make this city a curse to all the nations of the earth.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests and the prophets and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in Yahweh’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jeremiah had finished speaking all that Yahweh had commanded him to speak to all the people, the priests and the prophets and all the people seized him, saying, “You shall surely die!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why have you prophesied in Yahweh’s name, saying, ‘This house will be like Shiloh, and this city will be desolate, without inhabitant’?” All the people were crowded around Jeremiah in Yahweh’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the princes of Judah heard these things, they came up from the king’s house to Yahweh’s house; and they sat in the entry of the new gate of Yahweh’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priests and the prophets spoke to the princes and to all the people, saying, “This man is worthy of death, for he has prophesied against this city, as you have heard with your ears.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah spoke to all the princes and to all the people, saying, “Yahweh sent me to prophesy against this house and against this city all the words that you have heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore amend your ways and your doings, and obey Yahweh your God’s voice; then Yahweh will relent from the evil that he has pronounced against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for me, behold, I am in your hand. Do with me what is good and right in your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only know for certain that if you put me to death, you will bring innocent blood on yourselves, on this city, and on its inhabitants; for in truth Yahweh has sent me to you to speak all these words in your ears.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the princes and all the people said to the priests and to the prophets: “This man is not worthy of death; for he has spoken to us in the name of Yahweh our God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then certain of the elders of the land rose up, and spoke to all the assembly of the people, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Micah the Morashtite prophesied in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah; and he spoke to all the people of Judah, saying, ‘Yahweh of Armies says:
“‘Zion will be plowed as a field,
    and Jerusalem will become heaps,
    and the mountain of the house as the high places of a forest.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did Hezekiah king of Judah and all Judah put him to death? Didn’t he fear Yahweh, and entreat the favor of Yahweh, and Yahweh relented of the disaster which he had pronounced against them? We would commit great evil against our own souls that way!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was also a man who prophesied in Yahweh’s name, Uriah the son of Shemaiah of Kiriath Jearim; and he prophesied against this city and against this land according to all the words of Jeremiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jehoiakim the king, with all his mighty men and all the princes heard his words, the king sought to put him to death; but when Uriah heard it, he was afraid, and fled, and went into Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehoiakim the king sent Elnathan the son of Achbor and certain men with him into Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They fetched Uriah out of Egypt and brought him to Jehoiakim the king, who killed him with the sword and cast his dead body into the graves of the common people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the hand of Ahikam the son of Shaphan was with Jeremiah, so that they didn’t give him into the hand of the people to put him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh says to me: “Make bonds and bars, and put them on your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then send them to the king of Edom, to the king of Moab, to the king of the children of Ammon, to the king of Tyre, and to the king of Sidon, by the hand of the messengers who come to Jerusalem to Zedekiah king of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give them a command to their masters, saying, ‘Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel says, “You shall tell your masters:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I have made the earth, the men, and the animals that are on the surface of the earth by my great power and by my outstretched arm. I give it to whom it seems right to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I have given all these lands into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, my servant. I have also given the animals of the field to him to serve him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the nations will serve him, his son, and his son’s son, until the time of his own land comes. Then many nations and great kings will make him their bondservant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“‘It will happen that I will punish the nation and the kingdom which will not serve the same Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and that will not put their neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon,’ says Yahweh, ‘with the sword, with famine, and with pestilence, until I have consumed them by his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you, don’t listen to your prophets, to your diviners, to your dreams, to your soothsayers, or to your sorcerers, who speak to you, saying, “You shall not serve the king of Babylon;”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they prophesy a lie to you, to remove you far from your land, so that I would drive you out, and you would perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the nation that brings their neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon and serves him, that nation I will let remain in their own land,’ says Yahweh; ‘and they will till it and dwell in it.’”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I spoke to Zedekiah king of Judah according to all these words, saying, “Bring your necks under the yoke of the king of Babylon, and serve him and his people, and live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why will you die, you and your people, by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, as Yahweh has spoken concerning the nation that will not serve the king of Babylon?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t listen to the words of the prophets who speak to you, saying, ‘You shall not serve the king of Babylon;’ for they prophesy a lie to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have not sent them,” says Yahweh, “but they prophesy falsely in my name; that I may drive you out, and that you may perish, you, and the prophets who prophesy to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also I spoke to the priests and to all this people, saying, Yahweh says, “Don’t listen to the words of your prophets who prophesy to you, saying, ‘Behold, the vessels of Yahweh’s house will now shortly be brought again from Babylon;’ for they prophesy a lie to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t listen to them. Serve the king of Babylon, and live. Why should this city become a desolation?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they are prophets, and if Yahweh’s word is with them, let them now make intercession to Yahweh of Armies, that the vessels which are left in Yahweh’s house, in the house of the king of Judah, and at Jerusalem, don’t go to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh of Armies says concerning the pillars, concerning the sea, concerning the bases, and concerning the rest of the vessels that are left in this city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon didn’t take when he carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, from Jerusalem to Babylon, and all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yes, Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, says concerning the vessels that are left in Yahweh’s house, and in the house of the king of Judah, and at Jerusalem:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘They will be carried to Babylon, and there they will be, until the day that I visit them,’ says Yahweh; ‘then I will bring them up, and restore them to this place.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That same year, in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the fourth year, in the fifth month, Hananiah the son of Azzur, the prophet, who was of Gibeon, spoke to me in Yahweh’s house, in the presence of the priests and of all the people, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, says, ‘I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Within two full years I will bring again into this place all the vessels of Yahweh’s house that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took away from this place and carried to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring again to this place Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, with all the captives of Judah, who went to Babylon,’ says Yahweh; ‘for I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the prophet Jeremiah said to the prophet Hananiah in the presence of the priests, and in the presence of all the people who stood in Yahweh’s house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even the prophet Jeremiah said, “Amen! May Yahweh do so. May Yahweh perform your words which you have prophesied, to bring again the vessels of Yahweh’s house, and all those who are captives, from Babylon to this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless listen now to this word that I speak in your ears, and in the ears of all the people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prophets who have been before me and before you of old prophesied against many countries, and against great kingdoms, of war, of evil, and of pestilence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the prophet who prophesies of peace, when the word of the prophet happens, then the prophet will be known, that Yahweh has truly sent him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hananiah the prophet took the bar from off the prophet Jeremiah’s neck, and broke it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hananiah spoke in the presence of all the people, saying, “Yahweh says: ‘Even so I will break the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon from off the neck of all the nations within two full years.’” Then the prophet Jeremiah went his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh’s word came to Jeremiah, after Hananiah the prophet had broken the bar from off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go, and tell Hananiah, saying, ‘Yahweh says, “You have broken the bars of wood, but you have made in their place bars of iron.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel says, “I have put a yoke of iron on the neck of all these nations, that they may serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; and they will serve him. I have also given him the animals of the field.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the prophet Jeremiah said to Hananiah the prophet, “Listen, Hananiah! Yahweh has not sent you, but you make this people trust in a lie.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Yahweh says, ‘Behold, I will send you away from off the surface of the earth. This year you will die, because you have spoken rebellion against Yahweh.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Hananiah the prophet died the same year in the seventh month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the words of the letter that Jeremiah the prophet sent from Jerusalem to the residue of the elders of the captivity, and to the priests, to the prophets, and to all the people whom Nebuchadnezzar had carried away captive from Jerusalem to Babylon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (after Jeconiah the king, the queen mother, the eunuchs, the princes of Judah and Jerusalem, the craftsmen, and the smiths had departed from Jerusalem),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by the hand of Elasah the son of Shaphan and Gemariah the son of Hilkiah, (whom Zedekiah king of Judah sent to Babylon to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon). It said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, says to all the captives whom I have caused to be carried away captive from Jerusalem to Babylon:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Build houses and dwell in them. Plant gardens and eat their fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take wives and father sons and daughters. Take wives for your sons, and give your daughters to husbands, that they may bear sons and daughters. Multiply there, and don’t be diminished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seek the peace of the city where I have caused you to be carried away captive, and pray to Yahweh for it; for in its peace you will have peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel says: “Don’t let your prophets who are among you and your diviners deceive you. Don’t listen to your dreams which you cause to be dreamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they prophesy falsely to you in my name. I have not sent them,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh says, “After seventy years are accomplished for Babylon, I will visit you and perform my good word toward you, in causing you to return to this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know the thoughts that I think toward you,” says Yahweh, “thoughts of peace, and not of evil, to give you hope and a future.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall call on me, and you shall go and pray to me, and I will listen to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall seek me and find me, when you search for me with all your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will be found by you,” says Yahweh, “and I will turn again your captivity, and I will gather you from all the nations, and from all the places where I have driven you,” says Yahweh. “I will bring you again to the place from where I caused you to be carried away captive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because you have said, “Yahweh has raised us up prophets in Babylon,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh says concerning the king who sits on David’s throne, and concerning all the people who dwell in this city, your brothers who haven’t gone with you into captivity,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh of Armies says: “Behold, I will send on them the sword, the famine, and the pestilence, and will make them like rotten figs that can’t be eaten, they are so bad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will pursue after them with the sword, with the famine, and with the pestilence, and will deliver them to be tossed back and forth among all the kingdoms of the earth, to be an object of horror, an astonishment, a hissing, and a reproach among all the nations where I have driven them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they have not listened to my words,” says Yahweh, “with which I sent to them my servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them; but you would not hear,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear therefore Yahweh’s word, all you captives whom I have sent away from Jerusalem to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, says concerning Ahab the son of Kolaiah, and concerning Zedekiah the son of Maaseiah, who prophesy a lie to you in my name: “Behold, I will deliver them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; and he will kill them before your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A curse will be taken up about them by all the captives of Judah who are in Babylon, saying, ‘Yahweh make you like Zedekiah and like Ahab, whom the king of Babylon roasted in the fire;’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they have done foolish things in Israel, and have committed adultery with their neighbors’ wives, and have spoken words in my name falsely, which I didn’t command them. I am he who knows, and am witness,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite you shall speak, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, says, ‘Because you have sent letters in your own name to all the people who are at Jerusalem, and to Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah, the priest, and to all the priests, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yahweh has made you priest in the place of Jehoiada the priest, that there may be officers in Yahweh’s house, for every man who is crazy and makes himself a prophet, that you should put him in the stocks and in shackles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, why have you not rebuked Jeremiah of Anathoth, who makes himself a prophet to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he has sent to us in Babylon, saying, The captivity is long. Build houses, and dwell in them. Plant gardens, and eat their fruit?”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zephaniah the priest read this letter in the hearing of Jeremiah the prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh’s word came to Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Send to all of the captives, saying, ‘Yahweh says concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite: “Because Shemaiah has prophesied to you, and I didn’t send him, and he has caused you to trust in a lie,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore Yahweh says, “Behold, I will punish Shemaiah the Nehelamite and his offspring. He will not have a man to dwell among this people. He won’t see the good that I will do to my people,” says Yahweh, “because he has spoken rebellion against Yahweh.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yahweh, the God of Israel, says, ‘Write all the words that I have spoken to you in a book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For, behold, the days come,’ says Yahweh, ‘that I will reverse the captivity of my people Israel and Judah,’ says Yahweh. ‘I will cause them to return to the land that I gave to their fathers, and they will possess it.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the words that Yahweh spoke concerning Israel and concerning Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Ask now, and see whether a man travails with child.
    Why do I see every man with his hands on his waist, as a woman in travail,
    and all faces are turned pale?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
but they will serve Yahweh their God,
    and David their king,
    whom I will raise up to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore don’t be afraid, O Jacob my servant, says Yahweh.
    Don’t be dismayed, Israel.
For, behold, I will save you from afar,
    and save your offspring from the land of their captivity.
Jacob will return,
    and will be quiet and at ease.
    No one will make him afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For Yahweh says,
“Your hurt is incurable.
    Your wound is grievous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is no one to plead your cause,
    that you may be bound up.
    You have no healing medicines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All your lovers have forgotten you.
    They don’t seek you.
For I have wounded you with the wound of an enemy,
    with the chastisement of a cruel one,
for the greatness of your iniquity,
    because your sins were increased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you cry over your injury?
    Your pain is incurable.
For the greatness of your iniquity,
    because your sins have increased,
    I have done these things to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore all those who devour you will be devoured.
    All your adversaries, everyone of them, will go into captivity.
Those who plunder you will be plunder.
    I will make all who prey on you become prey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I will restore health to you,
    and I will heal you of your wounds,” says Yahweh,
“because they have called you an outcast,
    saying, ‘It is Zion, whom no man seeks after.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh says:
“Behold, I will reverse the captivity of Jacob’s tents,
    and have compassion on his dwelling places.
The city will be built on its own hill,
    and the palace will be inhabited in its own place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thanksgiving will proceed out of them
    with the voice of those who make merry.
I will multiply them,
    and they will not be few;
I will also glorify them,
    and they will not be small.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their children also will be as before,
    and their congregation will be established before me.
    I will punish all who oppress them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their prince will be one of them,
    and their ruler will proceed from among them.
I will cause him to draw near,
    and he will approach me;
    for who is he who has had boldness to approach me?” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You shall be my people,
    and I will be your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The fierce anger of Yahweh will not return until he has accomplished,
    and until he has performed the intentions of his heart.
    In the latter days you will understand it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time,” says Yahweh, “I will be the God of all the families of Israel, and they will be my people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh says, “The people who survive the sword found favor in the wilderness; even Israel, when I went to cause him to rest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh appeared of old to me, saying,
“Yes, I have loved you with an everlasting love.
    Therefore I have drawn you with loving kindness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will build you again,
    and you will be built, O virgin of Israel.
You will again be adorned with your tambourines,
    and will go out in the dances of those who make merry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Again you will plant vineyards on the mountains of Samaria.
    The planters will plant,
    and will enjoy its fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For there will be a day that the watchmen on the hills of Ephraim cry,
    ‘Arise! Let’s go up to Zion to Yahweh our God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Yahweh says,
“Sing with gladness for Jacob,
    and shout for the chief of the nations.
Publish, praise, and say,
    ‘Yahweh, save your people,
    the remnant of Israel!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I will bring them from the north country,
    and gather them from the uttermost parts of the earth,
along with the blind and the lame,
    the woman with child and her who travails with child together.
    They will return as a great company.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will come with weeping.
    I will lead them with petitions.
I will cause them to walk by rivers of waters,
    in a straight way in which they won’t stumble;
for I am a father to Israel.
    Ephraim is my firstborn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Hear Yahweh’s word, you nations,
    and declare it in the distant islands. Say,
‘He who scattered Israel will gather him,
    and keep him, as a shepherd does his flock.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Yahweh has ransomed Jacob,
    and redeemed him from the hand of him who was stronger than he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will come and sing in the height of Zion,
    and will flow to the goodness of Yahweh,
to the grain, to the new wine, to the oil,
    and to the young of the flock and of the herd.
Their soul will be as a watered garden.
    They will not sorrow any more at all.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will satiate the soul of the priests with fatness,
    and my people will be satisfied with my goodness,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh says:
“A voice is heard in Ramah,
    lamentation and bitter weeping,
Rachel weeping for her children.
    She refuses to be comforted for her children,
    because they are no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh says:
“Refrain your voice from weeping,
    and your eyes from tears,
    for your work will be rewarded,” says Yahweh.
    “They will come again from the land of the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is hope for your latter end,” says Yahweh.
    “Your children will come again to their own territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have surely heard Ephraim grieving thus,
    ‘You have chastised me,
    and I was chastised, as an untrained calf.
Turn me, and I will be turned,
    for you are Yahweh my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely after that I was turned.
    I repented.
After that I was instructed.
    I struck my thigh.
I was ashamed, yes, even confounded,
    because I bore the reproach of my youth.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is Ephraim my dear son?
    Is he a darling child?
For as often as I speak against him,
    I still earnestly remember him.
Therefore my heart yearns for him.
    I will surely have mercy on him,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Set up road signs.
    Make guideposts.
Set your heart toward the highway,
    even the way by which you went.
Turn again, virgin of Israel.
    Turn again to these your cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will you go here and there,
    you backsliding daughter?
For Yahweh has created a new thing in the earth:
    a woman will encompass a man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, says: “Yet again they will use this speech in the land of Judah and in its cities, when I reverse their captivity: ‘Yahweh bless you, habitation of righteousness, mountain of holiness.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah and all its cities will dwell therein together, the farmers, and those who go about with flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have satiated the weary soul, and I have replenished every sorrowful soul.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On this I awakened, and saw; and my sleep was sweet to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, the days come,” says Yahweh, “that I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man and with the seed of animal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will happen that, like as I have watched over them to pluck up and to break down and to overthrow and to destroy and to afflict, so I will watch over them to build and to plant,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“In those days they will say no more,
“‘The fathers have eaten sour grapes,
    and the children’s teeth are set on edge.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But everyone will die for his own iniquity. Every man who eats the sour grapes, his teeth will be set on edge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, the days come,” says Yahweh, “that I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel, and with the house of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day that I took them by the hand to bring them out of the land of Egypt, which covenant of mine they broke, although I was a husband to them,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days,” says Yahweh:
“I will put my law in their inward parts,
    and I will write it in their heart.
I will be their God,
    and they shall be my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh, who gives the sun for a light by day,
    and the ordinances of the moon and of the stars for a light by night,
who stirs up the sea, so that its waves roar—
    Yahweh of Armies is his name, says:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If these ordinances depart from before me,” says Yahweh,
    “then the offspring of Israel also will cease from being a nation before me forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh says: “If heaven above can be measured,
    and the foundations of the earth searched out beneath,
    then I will also cast off all the offspring of Israel for all that they have done,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, the days come,” says Yahweh, “that the city will be built to Yahweh from the tower of Hananel to the gate of the corner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The measuring line will go out further straight onward to the hill Gareb, and will turn toward Goah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole valley of the dead bodies and of the ashes, and all the fields to the brook Kidron, to the corner of the horse gate toward the east, will be holy to Yahweh. It will not be plucked up or thrown down any more forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh in the tenth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, which was the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at that time the king of Babylon’s army was besieging Jerusalem. Jeremiah the prophet was shut up in the court of the guard, which was in the king of Judah’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Zedekiah king of Judah had shut him up, saying, “Why do you prophesy, and say, ‘Yahweh says, “Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he will take it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Zedekiah king of Judah won’t escape out of the hand of the Chaldeans, but will surely be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon, and will speak with him mouth to mouth, and his eyes will see his eyes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he will bring Zedekiah to Babylon, and he will be there until I visit him,” says Yahweh, “though you fight with the Chaldeans, you will not prosper”’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeremiah said, “Yahweh’s word came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Behold, Hanamel the son of Shallum your uncle will come to you, saying, “Buy my field that is in Anathoth; for the right of redemption is yours to buy it.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“So Hanamel my uncle’s son came to me in the court of the guard according to Yahweh’s word, and said to me, ‘Please buy my field that is in Anathoth, which is in the land of Benjamin; for the right of inheritance is yours, and the redemption is yours. Buy it for yourself.’
“Then I knew that this was Yahweh’s word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I bought the field that was in Anathoth of Hanamel my uncle’s son, and weighed him the money, even seventeen shekels of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I signed the deed, sealed it, called witnesses, and weighed the money in the balances to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I took the deed of the purchase, both that which was sealed, containing the terms and conditions, and that which was open;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I delivered the deed of the purchase to Baruch the son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, in the presence of Hanamel my uncle’s son, and in the presence of the witnesses who signed the deed of the purchase, before all the Jews who sat in the court of the guard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I commanded Baruch before them, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘Take these deeds, this deed of the purchase which is sealed, and this deed which is open, and put them in an earthen vessel, that they may last many days.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel says: ‘Houses and fields and vineyards will yet again be bought in this land.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after I had delivered the deed of the purchase to Baruch the son of Neriah, I prayed to Yahweh, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Ah Lord Yahweh! Behold, you have made the heavens and the earth by your great power and by your outstretched arm. There is nothing too hard for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You show loving kindness to thousands, and repay the iniquity of the fathers into the bosom of their children after them. The great, the mighty God, Yahweh of Armies is your name:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: great in counsel, and mighty in work; whose eyes are open to all the ways of the children of men, to give everyone according to his ways, and according to the fruit of his doings;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who performed signs and wonders in the land of Egypt, even to this day, both in Israel and among other men; and made yourself a name, as it is today;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and brought your people Israel out of the land of Egypt with signs, with wonders, with a strong hand, with an outstretched arm, and with great terror;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and gave them this land, which you swore to their fathers to give them, a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came in and possessed it, but they didn’t obey your voice and didn’t walk in your law. They have done nothing of all that you commanded them to do. Therefore you have caused all this evil to come upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, siege ramps have been built against the city to take it. The city is given into the hand of the Chaldeans who fight against it, because of the sword, of the famine, and of the pestilence. What you have spoken has happened. Behold, you see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have said to me, Lord Yahweh, ‘Buy the field for money, and call witnesses;’ whereas the city is given into the hand of the Chaldeans.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh’s word came to Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, I am Yahweh, the God of all flesh. Is there anything too hard for me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Yahweh says: Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the Chaldeans, and into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he will take it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Chaldeans, who fight against this city, will come and set this city on fire, and burn it with the houses on whose roofs they have offered incense to Baal, and poured out drink offerings to other gods, to provoke me to anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the children of Israel and the children of Judah have done only that which was evil in my sight from their youth; for the children of Israel have only provoked me to anger with the work of their hands, says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this city has been to me a provocation of my anger and of my wrath from the day that they built it even to this day, so that I should remove it from before my face,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because of all the evil of the children of Israel and of the children of Judah, which they have done to provoke me to anger—they, their kings, their princes, their priests, their prophets, the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have turned their backs to me, and not their faces. Although I taught them, rising up early and teaching them, yet they have not listened to receive instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they set their abominations in the house which is called by my name, to defile it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They built the high places of Baal, which are in the valley of the son of Hinnom, to cause their sons and their daughters to pass through fire to Molech, which I didn’t command them. It didn’t even come into my mind, that they should do this abomination, to cause Judah to sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore Yahweh, the God of Israel, says concerning this city, about which you say, “It is given into the hand of the king of Babylon by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence:”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, I will gather them out of all the countries where I have driven them in my anger, and in my wrath, and in great indignation; and I will bring them again to this place. I will cause them to dwell safely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will be my people, and I will be their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give them one heart and one way, that they may fear me forever, for their good and the good of their children after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make an everlasting covenant with them, that I will not turn away from following them, to do them good. I will put my fear in their hearts, that they may not depart from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, I will rejoice over them to do them good, and I will plant them in this land assuredly with my whole heart and with my whole soul.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh says: “Just as I have brought all this great evil on this people, so I will bring on them all the good that I have promised them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fields will be bought in this land, about which you say, ‘It is desolate, without man or animal. It is given into the hand of the Chaldeans.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men will buy fields for money, sign the deeds, seal them, and call witnesses, in the land of Benjamin, and in the places around Jerusalem, in the cities of Judah, in the cities of the hill country, in the cities of the lowland, and in the cities of the South; for I will cause their captivity to be reversed,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover Yahweh’s word came to Jeremiah the second time, while he was still locked up in the court of the guard, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yahweh who does it, Yahweh who forms it to establish it—Yahweh is his name, says:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Call to me, and I will answer you, and will show you great and difficult things, which you don’t know.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh, the God of Israel, says concerning the houses of this city and concerning the houses of the kings of Judah, which are broken down to make a defense against the mounds and against the sword:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘While men come to fight with the Chaldeans, and to fill them with the dead bodies of men, whom I have killed in my anger and in my wrath, and for all whose wickedness I have hidden my face from this city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: behold, I will bring it health and healing, and I will cure them; and I will reveal to them abundance of peace and truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will restore the fortunes of Judah and Israel, and will build them as at the first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will cleanse them from all their iniquity by which they have sinned against me. I will pardon all their iniquities by which they have sinned against me and by which they have transgressed against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This city will be to me for a name of joy, for praise, and for glory, before all the nations of the earth, which will hear all the good that I do to them, and will fear and tremble for all the good and for all the peace that I provide to it.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh says: “Yet again there will be heard in this place, about which you say, ‘It is waste, without man and without animal, even in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, that are desolate, without man and without inhabitant and without animal,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the voice of joy and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the voice of those who say, ‘Give thanks to Yahweh of Armies, for Yahweh is good, for his loving kindness endures forever;’ who bring thanksgiving into Yahweh’s house. For I will cause the captivity of the land to be reversed as at the first,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh of Armies says: “Yet again there will be in this place, which is waste, without man and without animal, and in all its cities, a habitation of shepherds causing their flocks to lie down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the cities of the hill country, in the cities of the lowland, in the cities of the South, in the land of Benjamin, in the places around Jerusalem, and in the cities of Judah, the flocks will again pass under the hands of him who counts them,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, the days come,” says Yahweh, “that I will perform that good word which I have spoken concerning the house of Israel and concerning the house of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“In those days and at that time,
    I will cause a Branch of righteousness to grow up to David.
    He will execute justice and righteousness in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In those days Judah will be saved,
    and Jerusalem will dwell safely.
This is the name by which she will be called:
    Yahweh our righteousness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh says: “David will never lack a man to sit on the throne of the house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levitical priests won’t lack a man before me to offer burnt offerings, to burn meal offerings, and to do sacrifice continually.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came to Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator
