verses.text: “Yahweh says: ‘If you can break my covenant of the day and my covenant of the night, so that there will not be day and night in their time,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then my covenant could also be broken with David my servant, that he won’t have a son to reign on his throne; and with the Levitical priests, my ministers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the army of the sky can’t be counted, and the sand of the sea can’t be measured, so I will multiply the offspring of David my servant and the Levites who minister to me.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word came to Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Don’t consider what this people has spoken, saying, ‘Has Yahweh cast off the two families which he chose?’ Thus they despise my people, that they should be no more a nation before them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh says: “If my covenant of day and night fails, if I have not appointed the ordinances of heaven and earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will also cast away the offspring of Jacob, and of David my servant, so that I will not take of his offspring to be rulers over the offspring of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; for I will cause their captivity to be reversed and will have mercy on them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word which came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, with all his army, all the kingdoms of the earth that were under his dominion, and all the peoples, were fighting against Jerusalem and against all its cities, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yahweh, the God of Israel, says, ‘Go, and speak to Zedekiah king of Judah, and tell him, Yahweh says, “Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon and he will burn it with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You won’t escape out of his hand, but will surely be taken and delivered into his hand. Your eyes will see the eyes of the king of Babylon, and he will speak with you mouth to mouth. You will go to Babylon.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yet hear Yahweh’s word, O Zedekiah king of Judah. Yahweh says concerning you, ‘You won’t die by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will die in peace; and with the burnings of your fathers, the former kings who were before you, so they will make a burning for you. They will lament you, saying, “Ah Lord!” for I have spoken the word,’ says Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah the prophet spoke all these words to Zedekiah king of Judah in Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when the king of Babylon’s army was fighting against Jerusalem and against all the cities of Judah that were left, against Lachish and against Azekah; for these alone remained of the cities of Judah as fortified cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, after King Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people who were at Jerusalem, to proclaim liberty to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that every man should let his male servant, and every man his female servant, who is a Hebrew or a Hebrewess, go free, that no one should make bondservants of them, of a Jew his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the princes and all the people obeyed who had entered into the covenant, that everyone should let his male servant and everyone his female servant go free, that no one should make bondservants of them any more. They obeyed and let them go,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but afterwards they turned, and caused the servants and the handmaids whom they had let go free to return, and brought them into subjection for servants and for handmaids.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Yahweh’s word came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yahweh, the God of Israel, says: ‘I made a covenant with your fathers in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the end of seven years, every man of you shall release his brother who is a Hebrew, who has been sold to you, and has served you six years. You shall let him go free from you. But your fathers didn’t listen to me, and didn’t incline their ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You had now turned, and had done that which is right in my eyes, in every man proclaiming liberty to his neighbor. You had made a covenant before me in the house which is called by my name;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but you turned and profaned my name, and every man caused his servant and every man his handmaid, whom you had let go free at their pleasure, to return. You brought them into subjection, to be to you for servants and for handmaids.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Yahweh says: “You have not listened to me, to proclaim liberty, every man to his brother, and every man to his neighbor. Behold, I proclaim to you a liberty,” says Yahweh, “to the sword, to the pestilence, and to the famine. I will make you be tossed back and forth among all the kingdoms of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give the men who have transgressed my covenant, who have not performed the words of the covenant which they made before me when they cut the calf in two and passed between its parts:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the princes of Judah, the princes of Jerusalem, the eunuchs, the priests, and all the people of the land, who passed between the parts of the calf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will even give them into the hand of their enemies and into the hand of those who seek their life. Their dead bodies will be food for the birds of the sky and for the animals of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will give Zedekiah king of Judah and his princes into the hands of their enemies, into the hands of those who seek their life and into the hands of the king of Babylon’s army, who has gone away from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I will command,” says Yahweh, “and cause them to return to this city. They will fight against it, take it, and burn it with fire. I will make the cities of Judah a desolation, without inhabitant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word which came to Jeremiah from Yahweh in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go to the house of the Rechabites, and speak to them, and bring them into Yahweh’s house, into one of the rooms, and give them wine to drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I took Jaazaniah the son of Jeremiah, the son of Habazziniah, with his brothers, all his sons, and the whole house of the Rechabites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I brought them into Yahweh’s house, into the room of the sons of Hanan the son of Igdaliah, the man of God, which was by the room of the princes, which was above the room of Maaseiah the son of Shallum, the keeper of the threshold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I set before the sons of the house of the Rechabites bowls full of wine, and cups; and I said to them, “Drink wine!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they said, “We will drink no wine; for Jonadab the son of Rechab, our father, commanded us, saying, ‘You shall drink no wine, neither you nor your children, forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not build a house, sow seed, plant a vineyard, or have any; but all your days you shall dwell in tents, that you may live many days in the land in which you live as nomads.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have obeyed the voice of Jonadab the son of Rechab, our father, in all that he commanded us, to drink no wine all our days, we, our wives, our sons, or our daughters;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not to build houses for ourselves to dwell in. We have no vineyard, field, or seed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but we have lived in tents, and have obeyed, and done according to all that Jonadab our father commanded us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up into the land, we said, ‘Come! Let’s go to Jerusalem for fear of the army of the Chaldeans, and for fear of the army of the Syrians; so we will dwell at Jerusalem.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh’s word came to Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘Go and tell the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, “Will you not receive instruction to listen to my words?” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The words of Jonadab the son of Rechab that he commanded his sons, not to drink wine, are performed; and to this day they drink none, for they obey their father’s commandment; but I have spoken to you, rising up early and speaking, and you have not listened to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have sent also to you all my servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them, saying, ‘Every one of you must return now from his evil way, amend your doings, and don’t go after other gods to serve them. Then you will dwell in the land which I have given to you and to your fathers;’ but you have not inclined your ear, nor listened to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Jonadab the son of Rechab have performed the commandment of their father which he commanded them, but this people has not listened to me.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore Yahweh, the God of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘Behold, I will bring on Judah and on all the inhabitants of Jerusalem all the evil that I have pronounced against them, because I have spoken to them, but they have not heard; and I have called to them, but they have not answered.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeremiah said to the house of the Rechabites, “Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘Because you have obeyed the commandment of Jonadab your father, and kept all his precepts, and done according to all that he commanded you,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘Jonadab the son of Rechab will not lack a man to stand before me forever.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take a scroll of a book, and write in it all the words that I have spoken to you against Israel, against Judah, and against all the nations, from the day I spoke to you, from the days of Josiah even to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It may be that the house of Judah will hear all the evil which I intend to do to them, that they may each return from his evil way; that I may forgive their iniquity and their sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah called Baruch the son of Neriah; and Baruch wrote from the mouth of Jeremiah all Yahweh’s words, which he had spoken to him, on a scroll of a book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeremiah commanded Baruch, saying, “I am restricted. I can’t go into Yahweh’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you go, and read from the scroll which you have written from my mouth, Yahweh’s words, in the ears of the people in Yahweh’s house on the fast day. Also you shall read them in the ears of all Judah who come out of their cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It may be they will present their supplication before Yahweh, and will each return from his evil way; for Yahweh has pronounced great anger and wrath against this people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Baruch the son of Neriah did according to all that Jeremiah the prophet commanded him, reading in the book Yahweh’s words in Yahweh’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the fifth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, in the ninth month, all the people in Jerusalem and all the people who came from the cities of Judah to Jerusalem, proclaimed a fast before Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Baruch read the words of Jeremiah from the book in Yahweh’s house, in the room of Gemariah the son of Shaphan the scribe, in the upper court, at the entry of the new gate of Yahweh’s house, in the ears of all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Micaiah the son of Gemariah, the son of Shaphan, had heard out of the book all Yahweh’s words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he went down into the king’s house, into the scribe’s room; and behold, all the princes were sitting there, Elishama the scribe, Delaiah the son of Shemaiah, Elnathan the son of Achbor, Gemariah the son of Shaphan, Zedekiah the son of Hananiah, and all the princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Micaiah declared to them all the words that he had heard, when Baruch read the book in the ears of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore all the princes sent Jehudi the son of Nethaniah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Cushi, to Baruch, saying, “Take in your hand the scroll in which you have read in the ears of the people, and come.”
So Baruch the son of Neriah took the scroll in his hand, and came to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said to him, “Sit down now, and read it in our hearing.”
So Baruch read it in their hearing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they had heard all the words, they turned in fear one toward another, and said to Baruch, “We will surely tell the king of all these words.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked Baruch, saying, “Tell us now, how did you write all these words at his mouth?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Baruch answered them, “He dictated all these words to me with his mouth, and I wrote them with ink in the book.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the princes said to Baruch, “You and Jeremiah go hide. Don’t let anyone know where you are.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went in to the king into the court, but they had laid up the scroll in the room of Elishama the scribe. Then they told all the words in the hearing of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king sent Jehudi to get the scroll, and he took it out of the room of Elishama the scribe. Jehudi read it in the hearing of the king, and in the hearing of all the princes who stood beside the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the king was sitting in the winter house in the ninth month, and there was a fire in the brazier burning before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jehudi had read three or four columns, the king cut it with the penknife, and cast it into the fire that was in the brazier, until all the scroll was consumed in the fire that was in the brazier.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king and his servants who heard all these words were not afraid, and didn’t tear their garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover Elnathan and Delaiah and Gemariah had made intercession to the king that he would not burn the scroll; but he would not listen to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king commanded Jerahmeel the king’s son, and Seraiah the son of Azriel, and Shelemiah the son of Abdeel, to arrest Baruch the scribe and Jeremiah the prophet; but Yahweh hid them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh’s word came to Jeremiah, after the king had burned the scroll, and the words which Baruch wrote at the mouth of Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take again another scroll, and write in it all the former words that were in the first scroll, which Jehoiakim the king of Judah has burned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Concerning Jehoiakim king of Judah you shall say, ‘Yahweh says: “You have burned this scroll, saying, ‘Why have you written therein, saying, “The king of Babylon will certainly come and destroy this land, and will cause to cease from there man and animal”?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Yahweh says concerning Jehoiakim king of Judah: “He will have no one to sit on David’s throne. His dead body will be cast out in the day to the heat, and in the night to the frost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will punish him, his offspring, and his servants for their iniquity. I will bring on them, on the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and on the men of Judah, all the evil that I have pronounced against them, but they didn’t listen.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah took another scroll, and gave it to Baruch the scribe, the son of Neriah, who wrote therein from the mouth of Jeremiah all the words of the book which Jehoiakim king of Judah had burned in the fire; and many similar words were added to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zedekiah the son of Josiah reigned as king instead of Coniah the son of Jehoiakim, whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon made king in the land of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But neither he, nor his servants, nor the people of the land, listened to Yahweh’s words, which he spoke by the prophet Jeremiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zedekiah the king sent Jehucal the son of Shelemiah and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah, the priest, to the prophet Jeremiah, saying, “Pray now to Yahweh our God for us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jeremiah came in and went out among the people, for they had not put him into prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh’s army had come out of Egypt; and when the Chaldeans who were besieging Jerusalem heard news of them, they withdrew from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh’s word came to the prophet Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yahweh, the God of Israel, says, ‘You shall tell the king of Judah, who sent you to me to inquire of me: “Behold, Pharaoh’s army, which has come out to help you, will return to Egypt into their own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Chaldeans will come again, and fight against this city. They will take it and burn it with fire.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yahweh says, ‘Don’t deceive yourselves, saying, “The Chaldeans will surely depart from us;” for they will not depart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For though you had struck the whole army of the Chaldeans who fight against you, and only wounded men remained among them, they would each rise up in his tent and burn this city with fire.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the army of the Chaldeans had withdrawn from Jerusalem for fear of Pharaoh’s army,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then Jeremiah went out of Jerusalem to go into the land of Benjamin, to receive his portion there, in the middle of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he was in Benjamin’s gate, a captain of the guard was there, whose name was Irijah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Hananiah; and he seized Jeremiah the prophet, saying, “You are defecting to the Chaldeans!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Jeremiah said, “That is false! I am not defecting to the Chaldeans.”
But he didn’t listen to him; so Irijah seized Jeremiah, and brought him to the princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The princes were angry with Jeremiah, and struck him, and put him in prison in the house of Jonathan the scribe; for they had made that the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jeremiah had come into the dungeon house and into the cells, and Jeremiah had remained there many days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
then Zedekiah the king sent and had him brought out. The king asked him secretly in his house, “Is there any word from Yahweh?”
Jeremiah said, “There is.” He also said, “You will be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover Jeremiah said to King Zedekiah, “How have I sinned against you, against your servants, or against this people, that you have put me in prison?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now where are your prophets who prophesied to you, saying, ‘The king of Babylon will not come against you, nor against this land’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now please hear, my lord the king: please let my supplication be presented before you, that you not cause me to return to the house of Jonathan the scribe, lest I die there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zedekiah the king commanded, and they committed Jeremiah into the court of the guard. They gave him daily a loaf of bread out of the bakers’ street, until all the bread in the city was gone. Thus Jeremiah remained in the court of the guard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shephatiah the son of Mattan, Gedaliah the son of Pashhur, Jucal the son of Shelemiah, and Pashhur the son of Malchijah heard the words that Jeremiah spoke to all the people, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yahweh says, ‘He who remains in this city will die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, but he who goes out to the Chaldeans will live. He will escape with his life and he will live.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh says, ‘This city will surely be given into the hand of the army of the king of Babylon, and he will take it.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the princes said to the king, “Please let this man be put to death, because he weakens the hands of the men of war who remain in this city, and the hands of all the people, in speaking such words to them; for this man doesn’t seek the welfare of this people, but harm.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zedekiah the king said, “Behold, he is in your hand; for the king can’t do anything to oppose you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they took Jeremiah and threw him into the dungeon of Malchijah the king’s son, that was in the court of the guard. They let down Jeremiah with cords. In the dungeon there was no water, but mire; and Jeremiah sank in the mire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Ebedmelech the Ethiopian, a eunuch, who was in the king’s house, heard that they had put Jeremiah in the dungeon (the king was then sitting in Benjamin’s gate),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ebedmelech went out of the king’s house, and spoke to the king, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “My lord the king, these men have done evil in all that they have done to Jeremiah the prophet, whom they have cast into the dungeon. He is likely to die in the place where he is, because of the famine; for there is no more bread in the city.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king commanded Ebedmelech the Ethiopian, saying, “Take from here thirty men with you, and take up Jeremiah the prophet out of the dungeon, before he dies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Ebedmelech took the men with him, and went into the house of the king under the treasury, and took from there rags and worn-out garments, and let them down by cords into the dungeon to Jeremiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ebedmelech the Ethiopian said to Jeremiah, “Now put these rags and worn-out garments under your armpits under the cords.”
Jeremiah did so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they lifted Jeremiah up with the cords, and took him up out of the dungeon; and Jeremiah remained in the court of the guard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zedekiah the king sent and took Jeremiah the prophet to himself into the third entry that is in Yahweh’s house. Then the king said to Jeremiah, “I will ask you something. Hide nothing from me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah said to Zedekiah, “If I declare it to you, will you not surely put me to death? If I give you counsel, you will not listen to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Zedekiah the king swore secretly to Jeremiah, saying, “As Yahweh lives, who made our souls, I will not put you to death, neither will I give you into the hand of these men who seek your life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah said to Zedekiah, “Yahweh, the God of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘If you will go out to the king of Babylon’s princes, then your soul will live, and this city will not be burned with fire. You will live, along with your house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you will not go out to the king of Babylon’s princes, then this city will be given into the hand of the Chaldeans, and they will burn it with fire, and you won’t escape out of their hand.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zedekiah the king said to Jeremiah, “I am afraid of the Jews who have defected to the Chaldeans, lest they deliver me into their hand, and they mock me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jeremiah said, “They won’t deliver you. Obey, I beg you, Yahweh’s voice, in that which I speak to you; so it will be well with you, and your soul will live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you refuse to go out, this is the word that Yahweh has shown me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Behold, all the women who are left in the king of Judah’s house will be brought out to the king of Babylon’s princes, and those women will say,
“Your familiar friends have turned on you,
    and have prevailed over you.
Your feet are sunk in the mire,
    they have turned away from you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will bring out all your wives and your children to the Chaldeans. You won’t escape out of their hand, but will be taken by the hand of the king of Babylon. You will cause this city to be burned with fire.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zedekiah said to Jeremiah, “Let no man know of these words, and you won’t die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the princes hear that I have talked with you, and they come to you, and tell you, ‘Declare to us now what you have said to the king; don’t hide it from us, and we will not put you to death; also tell us what the king said to you;’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall tell them, ‘I presented my supplication before the king, that he would not cause me to return to Jonathan’s house, to die there.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the princes came to Jeremiah, and asked him; and he told them according to all these words that the king had commanded. So they stopped speaking with him, for the matter was not perceived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jeremiah stayed in the court of the guard until the day that Jerusalem was taken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the ninth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the tenth month, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and all his army came against Jerusalem, and besieged it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the eleventh year of Zedekiah, in the fourth month, the ninth day of the month, a breach was made in the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the princes of the king of Babylon came in, and sat in the middle gate: Nergal Sharezer, Samgarnebo, Sarsechim the Rabsaris, Nergal Sharezer the Rabmag, with all the rest of the princes of the king of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Zedekiah the king of Judah and all the men of war saw them, then they fled and went out of the city by night, by the way of the king’s garden, through the gate between the two walls; and he went out toward the Arabah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the army of the Chaldeans pursued them, and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho. When they had taken him, they brought him up to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon to Riblah in the land of Hamath; and he pronounced judgment on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king of Babylon killed Zedekiah’s sons in Riblah before his eyes. The king of Babylon also killed all the nobles of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover he put out Zedekiah’s eyes and bound him in fetters, to carry him to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Chaldeans burned the king’s house and the people’s houses with fire and broke down the walls of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive into Babylon the rest of the people who remained in the city, the deserters also who fell away to him, and the rest of the people who remained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left of the poor of the people, who had nothing, in the land of Judah, and gave them vineyards and fields at the same time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon commanded Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard concerning Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take him and take care of him. Do him no harm; but do to him even as he tells you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard, Nebushazban, Rabsaris, and Nergal Sharezer, Rabmag, and all the chief officers of the king of Babylon
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: sent and took Jeremiah out of the court of the guard, and committed him to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, that he should bring him home. So he lived among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Yahweh’s word came to Jeremiah while he was shut up in the court of the guard, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go, and speak to Ebedmelech the Ethiopian, saying, ‘Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, says: “Behold, I will bring my words on this city for evil, and not for good; and they will be accomplished before you in that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will deliver you in that day,” says Yahweh; “and you will not be given into the hand of the men of whom you are afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will surely save you. You won’t fall by the sword, but you will escape with your life, because you have put your trust in me,” says Yahweh.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word which came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, after Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had let him go from Ramah, when he had taken him being bound in chains among all the captives of Jerusalem and Judah who were carried away captive to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The captain of the guard took Jeremiah and said to him, “Yahweh your God pronounced this evil on this place;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Yahweh has brought it, and done according as he spoke. Because you have sinned against Yahweh, and have not obeyed his voice, therefore this thing has come on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, behold, I release you today from the chains which are on your hand. If it seems good to you to come with me into Babylon, come, and I will take care of you; but if it seems bad to you to come with me into Babylon, don’t. Behold, all the land is before you. Where it seems good and right to you to go, go there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now while he had not yet gone back, “Go back then,” he said, “to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, whom the king of Babylon has made governor over the cities of Judah, and dwell with him among the people; or go wherever it seems right to you to go.”
So the captain of the guard gave him food and a present, and let him go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah went to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam to Mizpah, and lived with him among the people who were left in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when all the captains of the forces who were in the fields, even they and their men, heard that the king of Babylon had made Gedaliah the son of Ahikam governor in the land, and had committed to him men, women, children, and of the poorest of the land, of those who were not carried away captive to Babylon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and Johanan and Jonathan the sons of Kareah, and Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth, and the sons of Ephai the Netophathite, and Jezaniah the son of the Maacathite, they and their men came to Gedaliah to Mizpah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan swore to them and to their men, saying, “Don’t be afraid to serve the Chaldeans. Dwell in the land, and serve the king of Babylon, and it will be well with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for me, behold, I will dwell at Mizpah, to stand before the Chaldeans who will come to us; but you, gather wine and summer fruits and oil, and put them in your vessels, and dwell in your cities that you have taken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise when all the Jews who were in Moab, and among the children of Ammon, and in Edom, and who were in all the countries, heard that the king of Babylon had left a remnant of Judah, and that he had set over them Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then all the Jews returned out of all places where they were driven, and came to the land of Judah, to Gedaliah, to Mizpah, and gathered very much wine and summer fruits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces who were in the fields, came to Gedaliah to Mizpah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and said to him, “Do you know that Baalis the king of the children of Ammon has sent Ishmael the son of Nethaniah to take your life?”
But Gedaliah the son of Ahikam didn’t believe them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Johanan the son of Kareah spoke to Gedaliah in Mizpah secretly, saying, “Please let me go, and I will kill Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and no man will know it. Why should he take your life, that all the Jews who are gathered to you should be scattered, and the remnant of Judah perish?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Gedaliah the son of Ahikam said to Johanan the son of Kareah, “You shall not do this thing, for you speak falsely of Ishmael.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the seventh month, Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, of the royal offspring and one of the chief officers of the king, and ten men with him, came to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam to Mizpah; and there they ate bread together in Mizpah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Ishmael the son of Nethaniah arose, and the ten men who were with him, and struck Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan with the sword and killed him, whom the king of Babylon had made governor over the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ishmael also killed all the Jews who were with Gedaliah at Mizpah, and the Chaldean men of war who were found there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second day after he had killed Gedaliah, and no man knew it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: men came from Shechem, from Shiloh, and from Samaria, even eighty men, having their beards shaved and their clothes torn, and having cut themselves, with meal offerings and frankincense in their hand, to bring them to Yahweh’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ishmael the son of Nethaniah went out from Mizpah to meet them, weeping all along as he went, and as he met them, he said to them, “Come to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was so, when they came into the middle of the city, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah killed them, and cast them into the middle of the pit, he, and the men who were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But ten men were found among those who said to Ishmael, “Don’t kill us; for we have stores hidden in the field, of wheat, and of barley, and of oil, and of honey.”
So he stopped, and didn’t kill them among their brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the pit in which Ishmael cast all the dead bodies of the men whom he had killed, by the side of Gedaliah (this was that which Asa the king had made for fear of Baasha king of Israel), Ishmael the son of Nethaniah filled it with those who were killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Ishmael carried away captive all of the people who were left in Mizpah, even the king’s daughters, and all the people who remained in Mizpah, whom Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had committed to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam. Ishmael the son of Nethaniah carried them away captive, and departed to go over to the children of Ammon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces who were with him, heard of all the evil that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had done,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then they took all the men, and went to fight with Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and found him by the great waters that are in Gibeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when all the people who were with Ishmael saw Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces who were with him, then they were glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the people who Ishmael had carried away captive from Mizpah turned about and came back, and went to Johanan the son of Kareah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Ishmael the son of Nethaniah escaped from Johanan with eight men, and went to the children of Ammon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Johanan the son of Kareah and all the captains of the forces who were with him took all the remnant of the people whom he had recovered from Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, from Mizpah, after he had killed Gedaliah the son of Ahikam—the men of war, with the women, the children, and the eunuchs, whom he had brought back from Gibeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They departed and lived in Geruth Chimham, which is by Bethlehem, to go to enter into Egypt
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because of the Chaldeans; for they were afraid of them, because Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had killed Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, whom the king of Babylon made governor over the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the captains of the forces, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and Jezaniah the son of Hoshaiah, and all the people from the least even to the greatest, came near,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to Jeremiah the prophet, “Please let our supplication be presented before you, and pray for us to Yahweh your God, even for all this remnant, for we are left but a few of many, as your eyes see us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that Yahweh your God may show us the way in which we should walk, and the things that we should do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah the prophet said to them, “I have heard you. Behold, I will pray to Yahweh your God according to your words; and it will happen that whatever thing Yahweh answers you, I will declare it to you. I will keep nothing back from you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to Jeremiah, “May Yahweh be a true and faithful witness among us, if we don’t do according to all the word with which Yahweh your God sends you to tell us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whether it is good, or whether it is bad, we will obey the voice of Yahweh our God, to whom we send you; that it may be well with us, when we obey the voice of Yahweh our God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After ten days, Yahweh’s word came to Jeremiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he called Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces who were with him, and all the people from the least even to the greatest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “Yahweh, the God of Israel, to whom you sent me to present your supplication before him, says:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If you will still live in this land, then I will build you, and not pull you down, and I will plant you, and not pluck you up; for I grieve over the distress that I have brought on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t be afraid of the king of Babylon, of whom you are afraid. Don’t be afraid of him,’ says Yahweh, ‘for I am with you to save you, and to deliver you from his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will grant you mercy, that he may have mercy on you, and cause you to return to your own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘But if you say, “We will not dwell in this land,” so that you don’t obey Yahweh your God’s voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “No, but we will go into the land of Egypt, where we will see no war, nor hear the sound of the trumpet, nor have hunger of bread; and there we will dwell;”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: now therefore hear Yahweh’s word, O remnant of Judah! Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, says, ‘If you indeed set your faces to enter into Egypt, and go to live there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then it will happen that the sword, which you fear, will overtake you there in the land of Egypt; and the famine, about which you are afraid, will follow close behind you there in Egypt; and you will die there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So will it be with all the men who set their faces to go into Egypt to live there. They will die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence. None of them will remain or escape from the evil that I will bring on them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘As my anger and my wrath has been poured out on the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so my wrath will be poured out on you, when you enter into Egypt; and you will be an object of horror, an astonishment, a curse, and a reproach; and you will see this place no more.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yahweh has spoken concerning you, remnant of Judah, ‘Don’t go into Egypt!’ Know certainly that I have testified to you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you have dealt deceitfully against your own souls; for you sent me to Yahweh your God, saying, ‘Pray for us to Yahweh our God; and according to all that Yahweh our God says, so declare to us, and we will do it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have declared it to you today; but you have not obeyed Yahweh your God’s voice in anything for which he has sent me to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore know certainly that you will die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence in the place where you desire to go to live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jeremiah had finished speaking to all the people all the words of Yahweh their God, with which Yahweh their God had sent him to them, even all these words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then Azariah the son of Hoshaiah, Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the proud men spoke, saying to Jeremiah, “You speak falsely. Yahweh our God has not sent you to say, ‘You shall not go into Egypt to live there;’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but Baruch the son of Neriah has turned you against us, to deliver us into the hand of the Chaldeans, that they may put us to death or carry us away captive to Babylon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces, and all the people, didn’t obey Yahweh’s voice, to dwell in the land of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Johanan the son of Kareah and all the captains of the forces took all the remnant of Judah, who had returned from all the nations where they had been driven, to live in the land of Judah—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the men, the women, the children, the king’s daughters, and every person who Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had left with Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan; and Jeremiah the prophet, and Baruch the son of Neriah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came into the land of Egypt, for they didn’t obey Yahweh’s voice; and they came to Tahpanhes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh’s word came to Jeremiah in Tahpanhes, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take great stones in your hand and hide them in mortar in the brick work which is at the entry of Pharaoh’s house in Tahpanhes, in the sight of the men of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell them, Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘Behold, I will send and take Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, my servant, and will set his throne on these stones that I have hidden; and he will spread his royal pavilion over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will come, and will strike the land of Egypt; such as are for death will be put to death, and such as are for captivity to captivity, and such as are for the sword to the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will kindle a fire in the houses of the gods of Egypt. He will burn them, and carry them away captive. He will array himself with the land of Egypt, as a shepherd puts on his garment; and he will go out from there in peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will also break the pillars of Beth Shemesh that is in the land of Egypt; and he will burn the houses of the gods of Egypt with fire.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the Jews who lived in the land of Egypt, who lived at Migdol, and at Tahpanhes, and at Memphis, and in the country of Pathros, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘You have seen all the evil that I have brought on Jerusalem, and on all the cities of Judah. Behold, today they are a desolation, and no man dwells in them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because of their wickedness which they have committed to provoke me to anger, in that they went to burn incense, to serve other gods that they didn’t know, neither they, nor you, nor your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However I sent to you all my servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them, saying, “Oh, don’t do this abominable thing that I hate.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they didn’t listen and didn’t incline their ear. They didn’t turn from their wickedness, to stop burning incense to other gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore my wrath and my anger was poured out, and was kindled in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem; and they are wasted and desolate, as it is today.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore now Yahweh, the God of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘Why do you commit great evil against your own souls, to cut off from yourselves man and woman, infant and nursing child out of the middle of Judah, to leave yourselves no one remaining,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in that you provoke me to anger with the works of your hands, burning incense to other gods in the land of Egypt where you have gone to live, that you may be cut off, and that you may be a curse and a reproach among all the nations of the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have you forgotten the wickedness of your fathers, the wickedness of the kings of Judah, the wickedness of their wives, your own wickedness, and the wickedness of your wives which they committed in the land of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are not humbled even to this day, neither have they feared, nor walked in my law, nor in my statutes, that I set before you and before your fathers.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘Behold, I will set my face against you for evil, even to cut off all Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will take the remnant of Judah that have set their faces to go into the land of Egypt to live there, and they will all be consumed. They will fall in the land of Egypt. They will be consumed by the sword and by the famine. They will die, from the least even to the greatest, by the sword and by the famine. They will be an object of horror, an astonishment, a curse, and a reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will punish those who dwell in the land of Egypt, as I have punished Jerusalem, by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that none of the remnant of Judah, who have gone into the land of Egypt to live there, will escape or be left to return into the land of Judah, to which they have a desire to return to dwell there; for no one will return except those who will escape.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the men who knew that their wives burned incense to other gods, and all the women who stood by, a great assembly, even all the people who lived in the land of Egypt, in Pathros, answered Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for the word that you have spoken to us in Yahweh’s name, we will not listen to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we will certainly perform every word that has gone out of our mouth, to burn incense to the queen of the sky and to pour out drink offerings to her, as we have done, we and our fathers, our kings and our princes, in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem; for then we had plenty of food, and were well, and saw no evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But since we stopped burning incense to the queen of the sky, and pouring out drink offerings to her, we have lacked all things, and have been consumed by the sword and by the famine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The women said, “When we burned incense to the queen of the sky and poured out drink offerings to her, did we make her cakes to worship her, and pour out drink offerings to her, without our husbands?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah said to all the people—to the men and to the women, even to all the people who had given him an answer, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The incense that you burned in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, you and your fathers, your kings and your princes, and the people of the land, didn’t Yahweh remember them, and didn’t it come into his mind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Yahweh could no longer bear it, because of the evil of your doings and because of the abominations which you have committed. Therefore your land has become a desolation, an astonishment, and a curse, without inhabitant, as it is today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because you have burned incense and because you have sinned against Yahweh, and have not obeyed Yahweh’s voice, nor walked in his law, nor in his statutes, nor in his testimonies; therefore this evil has happened to you, as it is today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover Jeremiah said to all the people, including all the women, “Hear Yahweh’s word, all Judah who are in the land of Egypt!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, says, ‘You and your wives have both spoken with your mouths, and with your hands have fulfilled it, saying, “We will surely perform our vows that we have vowed, to burn incense to the queen of the sky, and to pour out drink offerings to her.”
“‘Establish then your vows, and perform your vows.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore hear Yahweh’s word, all Judah who dwell in the land of Egypt: ‘Behold, I have sworn by my great name,’ says Yahweh, ‘that my name will no more be named in the mouth of any man of Judah in all the land of Egypt, saying, “As the Lord Yahweh lives.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I watch over them for evil, and not for good; and all the men of Judah who are in the land of Egypt will be consumed by the sword and by the famine, until they are all gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who escape the sword will return out of the land of Egypt into the land of Judah few in number. All the remnant of Judah, who have gone into the land of Egypt to live there, will know whose word will stand, mine or theirs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘This will be the sign to you,’ says Yahweh, ‘that I will punish you in this place, that you may know that my words will surely stand against you for evil.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh says, ‘Behold, I will give Pharaoh Hophra king of Egypt into the hand of his enemies and into the hand of those who seek his life, just as I gave Zedekiah king of Judah into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, who was his enemy and sought his life.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The message that Jeremiah the prophet spoke to Baruch the son of Neriah, when he wrote these words in a book at the mouth of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yahweh, the God of Israel, says to you, Baruch:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘You said, “Woe is me now! For Yahweh has added sorrow to my pain! I am weary with my groaning, and I find no rest.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall tell him, Yahweh says: ‘Behold, that which I have built, I will break down, and that which I have planted I will pluck up; and this in the whole land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you seek great things for yourself? Don’t seek them; for, behold, I will bring evil on all flesh,’ says Yahweh, ‘but I will let you escape with your life wherever you go.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word which came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Egypt: concerning the army of Pharaoh Necoh king of Egypt, which was by the river Euphrates in Carchemish, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon struck in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Prepare the buckler and shield,
    and draw near to battle!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Harness the horses, and get up, you horsemen,
    and stand up with your helmets.
Polish the spears,
    put on the coats of mail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why have I seen it?
    They are dismayed and are turned backward.
Their mighty ones are beaten down,
    have fled in haste,
    and don’t look back.
Terror is on every side,”
    says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Don’t let the swift flee away,
    nor the mighty man escape.
In the north by the river Euphrates
    they have stumbled and fallen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Who is this who rises up like the Nile,
    like rivers whose waters surge?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Egypt rises up like the Nile,
    like rivers whose waters surge.
He says, ‘I will rise up. I will cover the earth.
    I will destroy cities and its inhabitants.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go up, you horses!
    Rage, you chariots!
Let the mighty men go out:
    Cush and Put, who handle the shield;
    and the Ludim, who handle and bend the bow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For that day is of the Lord, Yahweh of Armies,
    a day of vengeance,
    that he may avenge himself of his adversaries.
The sword will devour and be satiated,
    and will drink its fill of their blood;
    for the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, has a sacrifice in the north country by the river Euphrates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go up into Gilead, and take balm, virgin daughter of Egypt.
    You use many medicines in vain.
    There is no healing for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: The word that Yahweh spoke to Jeremiah the prophet, how that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon should come and strike the land of Egypt:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Declare in Egypt,
    publish in Migdol,
    and publish in Memphis and in Tahpanhes;
say, ‘Stand up, and prepare,
    for the sword has devoured around you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why are your strong ones swept away?
    They didn’t stand, because Yahweh pushed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made many to stumble.
    Yes, they fell on one another.
They said, ‘Arise! Let’s go again to our own people,
    and to the land of our birth,
    from the oppressing sword.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They cried there, ‘Pharaoh king of Egypt is but a noise;
    he has let the appointed time pass by.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“As I live,” says the King,
    whose name is Yahweh of Armies,
“surely like Tabor among the mountains,
    and like Carmel by the sea,
    so he will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Also her hired men in the middle of her are like calves of the stall,
    for they also are turned back.
    They have fled away together.
They didn’t stand,
    for the day of their calamity has come on them,
    the time of their visitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They will cut down her forest,” says Yahweh,
    “though it can’t be searched;
because they are more than the locusts,
    and are innumerable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The daughter of Egypt will be disappointed;
    she will be delivered into the hand of the people of the north.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, says: “Behold, I will punish Amon of No, and Pharaoh, and Egypt, with her gods and her kings, even Pharaoh, and those who trust in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will deliver them into the hand of those who seek their lives, and into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of his servants. Afterwards it will be inhabited, as in the days of old,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But don’t you be afraid, Jacob my servant.
    Don’t be dismayed, Israel;
for, behold, I will save you from afar,
    and your offspring from the land of their captivity.
Jacob will return,
    and will be quiet and at ease.
    No one will make him afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the Philistines, before Pharaoh struck Gaza.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh says:
“Behold, waters rise up out of the north,
    and will become an overflowing stream,
and will overflow the land and all that is therein,
    the city and those who dwell therein.
The men will cry,
    and all the inhabitants of the land will wail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At the noise of the stamping of the hoofs of his strong ones,
    at the rushing of his chariots,
    at the rumbling of his wheels,
the fathers don’t look back for their children
    because their hands are so feeble,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Baldness has come on Gaza;
    Ashkelon is brought to nothing.
You remnant of their valley,
    how long will you cut yourself?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“How can you be quiet,
    since Yahweh has given you a command?
Against Ashkelon, and against the seashore,
    there he has appointed it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of Moab. Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, says:
“Woe to Nebo!
    For it is laid waste.
Kiriathaim is disappointed.
    It is taken.
Misgab is put to shame
    and broken down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The praise of Moab is no more.
    In Heshbon they have devised evil against her:
    ‘Come! Let’s cut her off from being a nation.’
You also, Madmen, will be brought to silence.
    The sword will pursue you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sound of a cry from Horonaim,
    desolation and great destruction!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moab is destroyed.
    Her little ones have caused a cry to be heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they will go up by the ascent of Luhith with continual weeping.
    For at the descent of Horonaim they have heard the distress of the cry of destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Flee! Save your lives!
    Be like the juniper bush in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For, because you have trusted in your works and in your treasures,
    you also will be taken.
Chemosh will go out into captivity,
    his priests and his princes together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The destroyer will come on every city,
    and no city will escape;
the valley also will perish,
    and the plain will be destroyed, as Yahweh has spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give wings to Moab,
    that she may fly and get herself away:
and her cities will become a desolation,
    without anyone to dwell in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Cursed is he who does the work of Yahweh negligently;
    and cursed is he who keeps back his sword from blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Moab has been at ease from his youth,
    and he has settled on his dregs,
and has not been emptied from vessel to vessel,
    neither has he gone into captivity;
therefore his taste remains in him,
    and his scent is not changed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore behold, the days come,” says Yahweh,
    “that I will send to him those who pour off,
and they will pour him off;
    and they will empty his vessels,
    and break their containers in pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moab will be ashamed of Chemosh,
    as the house of Israel was ashamed of Bethel, their confidence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How do you say, ‘We are mighty men,
    and valiant men for the war’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moab is laid waste,
    and they have gone up into his cities,
    and his chosen young men have gone down to the slaughter,”
    says the King, whose name is Yahweh of Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The calamity of Moab is near to come,
    and his affliction hurries fast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All you who are around him, bemoan him;
    and all you who know his name, say,
‘How the strong staff is broken,
    the beautiful rod!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You daughter who dwells in Dibon,
    come down from your glory,
    and sit in thirst;
for the destroyer of Moab has come up against you.
    He has destroyed your strongholds.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Moab is disappointed;
    for it is broken down.
Wail and cry!
    Tell it by the Arnon, that Moab is laid waste.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judgment has come on the plain country—
    on Holon, on Jahzah, on Mephaath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: on Dibon, on Nebo, on Beth Diblathaim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: on Kiriathaim, on Beth Gamul, on Beth Meon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
on Kerioth, on Bozrah,
    and on all the cities of the land of Moab, far or near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The horn of Moab is cut off,
    and his arm is broken,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Make him drunk,
    for he magnified himself against Yahweh.
Moab will wallow in his vomit,
    and he also will be in derision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For wasn’t Israel a derision to you?
    Was he found among thieves?
For as often as you speak of him,
    you shake your head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You inhabitants of Moab, leave the cities, and dwell in the rock.
    Be like the dove that makes her nest over the mouth of the abyss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“We have heard of the pride of Moab.
    He is very proud in his loftiness, his pride,
    his arrogance, and the arrogance of his heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know his wrath,” says Yahweh, “that it is nothing;
    his boastings have done nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I will wail for Moab.
    Yes, I will cry out for all Moab.
    They will mourn for the men of Kir Heres.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With more than the weeping of Jazer
    I will weep for you, vine of Sibmah.
Your branches passed over the sea.
    They reached even to the sea of Jazer.
The destroyer has fallen on your summer fruits
    and on your vintage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gladness and joy is taken away from the fruitful field
    and from the land of Moab.
I have caused wine to cease from the wine presses.
    No one will tread with shouting.
    The shouting will be no shouting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the cry of Heshbon even to Elealeh,
    even to Jahaz they have uttered their voice,
    from Zoar even to Horonaim, to Eglath Shelishiyah;
    for the waters of Nimrim will also become desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moreover I will cause to cease in Moab,” says Yahweh,
    “him who offers in the high place,
    and him who burns incense to his gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore my heart sounds for Moab like flutes,
    and my heart sounds like flutes for the men of Kir Heres.
    Therefore the abundance that he has gotten has perished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For every head is bald,
    and every beard clipped.
There are cuttings on all the hands,
    and sackcloth on the waist.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“How it is broken down!
    How they wail!
How Moab has turned the back with shame!
    So will Moab become a derision
    and a terror to all who are around him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Yahweh says: “Behold, he will fly as an eagle,
    and will spread out his wings against Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Kerioth is taken,
    and the strongholds are seized.
The heart of the mighty men of Moab at that day
    will be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moab will be destroyed from being a people,
    because he has magnified himself against Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Terror, the pit, and the snare are on you,
    inhabitant of Moab,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Yet I will reverse the captivity of Moab in the latter days,”
    says Yahweh.
Thus far is the judgment of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of the children of Ammon. Yahweh says:
“Has Israel no sons?
    Has he no heir?
Why then does Malcam possess Gad,
    and his people dwell in its cities?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore behold, the days come,”
    says Yahweh,
“that I will cause an alarm of war to be heard against Rabbah of the children of Ammon,
    and it will become a desolate heap,
    and her daughters will be burned with fire;
then Israel will possess those who possessed him,”
    says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you boast in the valleys,
    your flowing valley, backsliding daughter?
You trusted in her treasures,
    saying, ‘Who will come to me?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I will bring a terror on you,”
    says the Lord, Yahweh of Armies,
“from all who are around you.
    All of you will be driven completely out,
    and there will be no one to gather together the fugitives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But afterward I will reverse the captivity of the children of Ammon,”
    says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of Edom, Yahweh of Armies says:
“Is wisdom no more in Teman?
    Has counsel perished from the prudent?
    Has their wisdom vanished?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
If grape gatherers came to you,
    would they not leave some gleaning grapes?
If thieves came by night,
    wouldn’t they steal until they had enough?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I have made Esau bare,
    I have uncovered his secret places,
    and he will not be able to hide himself.
His offspring is destroyed,
    with his brothers and his neighbors;
    and he is no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Leave your fatherless children.
    I will preserve them alive.
    Let your widows trust in me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh says: “Behold, they to whom it didn’t pertain to drink of the cup will certainly drink; and are you he who will altogether go unpunished? You won’t go unpunished, but you will surely drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have sworn by myself,” says Yahweh, “that Bozrah will become an astonishment, a reproach, a waste, and a curse. All its cities will be perpetual wastes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have heard news from Yahweh,
    and an ambassador is sent among the nations,
saying, “Gather yourselves together!
    Come against her!
    Rise up to the battle!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For, behold, I have made you small among the nations,
    and despised among men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for your terror,
    the pride of your heart has deceived you,
O you who dwell in the clefts of the rock,
    who hold the height of the hill,
though you should make your nest as high as the eagle,
    I will bring you down from there,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Edom will become an astonishment.
    Everyone who passes by it will be astonished,
    and will hiss at all its plagues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As in the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and its neighbor cities,” says Yahweh,
    “no man will dwell there,
    neither will any son of man live therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, he will come up like a lion from the pride of the Jordan against the strong habitation;
    for I will suddenly make them run away from it,
and whoever is chosen,
    I will appoint him over it.
For who is like me?
    Who will appoint me a time?
    Who is the shepherd who will stand before me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore hear the counsel of Yahweh, that he has taken against Edom,
    and his purposes that he has purposed against the inhabitants of Teman:
Surely they will drag them away,
    the little ones of the flock.
    Surely he will make their habitation desolate over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth trembles at the noise of their fall;
    there is a cry, the noise which is heard in the Red Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, he will come up and fly as the eagle,
    and spread out his wings against Bozrah.
    The heart of the mighty men of Edom at that day will be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of Damascus:
“Hamath and Arpad are confounded,
    for they have heard evil news.
    They have melted away.
There is sorrow on the sea.
    It can’t be quiet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Damascus has grown feeble,
    she turns herself to flee,
    and trembling has seized her.
Anguish and sorrows have taken hold of her,
    as of a woman in travail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How is the city of praise not forsaken,
    the city of my joy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore her young men will fall in her streets,
    and all the men of war will be brought to silence in that day,”
    says Yahweh of Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will kindle a fire in the wall of Damascus,
    and it will devour the palaces of Ben Hadad.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of Kedar, and of the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon struck, Yahweh says:
“Arise, go up to Kedar,
    and destroy the children of the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will take their tents and their flocks.
    they will carry away for themselves their curtains,
    all their vessels, and their camels;
    and they will cry to them, ‘Terror on every side!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Flee!
    Wander far off!
Dwell in the depths, you inhabitants of Hazor,” says Yahweh;
    “for Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has taken counsel against you,
    and has conceived a purpose against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Arise! Go up to a nation that is at ease,
    that dwells without care,” says Yahweh;
    “that has neither gates nor bars,
    that dwells alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their camels will be a booty,
    and the multitude of their livestock a plunder.
I will scatter to all winds those who have the corners of their beards cut off;
    and I will bring their calamity from every side of them,”
    says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hazor will be a dwelling place of jackals,
    a desolation forever.
No man will dwell there,
    neither will any son of man live therein.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s word that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning Elam, in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Yahweh of Armies says:
‘Behold, I will break the bow of Elam,
    the chief of their might.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will bring on Elam the four winds from the four quarters of the sky,
    and will scatter them toward all those winds.
    There will be no nation where the outcasts of Elam will not come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will cause Elam to be dismayed before their enemies,
    and before those who seek their life.
I will bring evil on them, even my fierce anger,’ says Yahweh;
    ‘and I will send the sword after them,
    until I have consumed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will set my throne in Elam,
    and will destroy from there king and princes,’ says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘But it will happen in the latter days
    that I will reverse the captivity of Elam,’ says Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that Yahweh spoke concerning Babylon, concerning the land of the Chaldeans, by Jeremiah the prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Declare among the nations and publish,
    and set up a standard;
    publish, and don’t conceal;
say, ‘Babylon has been taken,
    Bel is disappointed,
    Merodach is dismayed!
Her images are disappointed.
    Her idols are dismayed.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a nation comes up out of the north against her,
    which will make her land desolate,
    and no one will dwell in it.
They have fled.
    They are gone,
    both man and animal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“In those days, and in that time,” says Yahweh,
    “the children of Israel will come,
    they and the children of Judah together;
they will go on their way weeping,
    and will seek Yahweh their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will inquire concerning Zion with their faces turned toward it,
    saying, ‘Come, and join yourselves to Yahweh in an everlasting covenant
    that will not be forgotten.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My people have been lost sheep.
    Their shepherds have caused them to go astray.
They have turned them away on the mountains.
    They have gone from mountain to hill.
    They have forgotten their resting place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All who found them have devoured them.
    Their adversaries said, ‘We are not guilty,
because they have sinned against Yahweh,
    the habitation of righteousness,
    even Yahweh, the hope of their fathers.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Flee out of the middle of Babylon!
    Go out of the land of the Chaldeans,
    and be as the male goats before the flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For, behold, I will stir up
    and cause to come up against Babylon a company of great nations from the north country;
    and they will set themselves in array against her.
She will be taken from there.
    Their arrows will be as of an expert mighty man.
    None of them will return in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Chaldea will be a prey.
    All who prey on her will be satisfied,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Because you are glad,
    because you rejoice,
O you who plunder my heritage,
    because you are wanton as a heifer that treads out the grain,
    and neigh as strong horses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
your mother will be utterly disappointed.
    She who bore you will be confounded.
Behold, she will be the least of the nations,
    a wilderness, a dry land, and a desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of Yahweh’s wrath she won’t be inhabited,
    but she will be wholly desolate.
Everyone who goes by Babylon will be astonished,
    and hiss at all her plagues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Set yourselves in array against Babylon all around,
    all you who bend the bow;
    shoot at her.
Spare no arrows,
    for she has sinned against Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shout against her all around.
    She has submitted herself.
    Her bulwarks have fallen.
Her walls have been thrown down,
    for it is the vengeance of Yahweh.
Take vengeance on her.
    As she has done, do to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cut off the sower from Babylon,
    and him who handles the sickle in the time of harvest.
For fear of the oppressing sword,
    they will each return to their own people,
    and they will each flee to their own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Israel is a hunted sheep.
    The lions have driven him away.
First, the king of Assyria devoured him,
    and now at last Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has broken his bones.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, says:
“Behold, I will punish the king of Babylon and his land,
    as I have punished the king of Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will bring Israel again to his pasture,
    and he will feed on Carmel and Bashan.
    His soul will be satisfied on the hills of Ephraim and in Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In those days, and in that time,” says Yahweh,
    “the iniquity of Israel will be sought for,
    and there will be none,
also the sins of Judah,
    and they won’t be found;
    for I will pardon them whom I leave as a remnant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Go up against the land of Merathaim,
    even against it, and against the inhabitants of Pekod.
Kill and utterly destroy after them,” says Yahweh,
    “and do according to all that I have commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A sound of battle is in the land,
    and of great destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How the hammer of the whole earth is cut apart and broken!
    How Babylon has become a desolation among the nations!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have laid a snare for you,
    and you are also taken, Babylon,
    and you weren’t aware.
You are found,
    and also caught,
    because you have fought against Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Come against her from the farthest border.
    Open her storehouses.
    Cast her up as heaps.
Destroy her utterly.
    Let nothing of her be left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Kill all her bulls.
    Let them go down to the slaughter.
Woe to them! For their day has come,
    the time of their visitation.
