verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to those who flee and escape out of the land of Babylon,
    to declare in Zion the vengeance of Yahweh our God,
    the vengeance of his temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Call together the archers against Babylon,
    all those who bend the bow.
Encamp against her all around.
    Let none of it escape.
Pay her back according to her work.
    According to all that she has done, do to her;
for she has been proud against Yahweh,
    against the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore her young men will fall in her streets.
    All her men of war will be brought to silence in that day,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The proud one will stumble and fall,
    and no one will raise him up.
I will kindle a fire in his cities,
    and it will devour all who are around him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh of Armies says: “The children of Israel and the children of Judah are oppressed together.
    All who took them captive hold them fast.
    They refuse to let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their Redeemer is strong.
    Yahweh of Armies is his name.
He will thoroughly plead their cause,
    that he may give rest to the earth,
    and disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“A sword is on the Chaldeans,” says Yahweh,
    “and on the inhabitants of Babylon,
    on her princes,
    and on her wise men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A sword is on the boasters,
    and they will become fools.
A sword is on her mighty men,
    and they will be dismayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A sword is on their horses,
    on their chariots,
    and on all the mixed people who are in the middle of her;
    and they will become as women.
A sword is on her treasures,
    and they will be robbed.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the wild animals of the desert
    with the wolves will dwell there.
The ostriches will dwell therein.
    It will be inhabited no more forever,
    neither will it be lived in from generation to generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah and its neighbor cities,” says Yahweh,
    “so no man will dwell there,
    neither will any son of man live therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, a people comes from the north.
    A great nation and many kings will be stirred up from the uttermost parts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They take up bow and spear.
    They are cruel, and have no mercy.
    Their voice roars like the sea.
They ride on horses,
    everyone set in array,
    as a man to the battle,
    against you, daughter of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king of Babylon has heard the news of them,
    and his hands become feeble.
Anguish has taken hold of him,
    pains as of a woman in labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, the enemy will come up like a lion
    from the thickets of the Jordan against the strong habitation;
    for I will suddenly make them run away from it.
Whoever is chosen,
    I will appoint him over it,
    for who is like me?
Who will appoint me a time?
    Who is the shepherd who can stand before me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore hear the counsel of Yahweh
    that he has taken against Babylon;
and his purposes
    that he has purposed against the land of the Chaldeans:
Surely they will drag them away,
    even the little ones of the flock.
    Surely he will make their habitation desolate over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth trembles at the noise of the taking of Babylon.
    The cry is heard among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh says:
“Behold, I will raise up against Babylon,
    and against those who dwell in Lebkamai, a destroying wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Against him who bends, let the archer bend his bow,
    also against him who lifts himself up in his coat of mail.
Don’t spare her young men!
    Utterly destroy all her army!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will fall down slain in the land of the Chaldeans,
    and thrust through in her streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Flee out of the middle of Babylon!
    Everyone save his own life!
Don’t be cut off in her iniquity,
    for it is the time of Yahweh’s vengeance.
    He will render to her a recompense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Babylon has been a golden cup in Yahweh’s hand,
    who made all the earth drunk.
The nations have drunk of her wine;
    therefore the nations have gone mad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Babylon has suddenly fallen and been destroyed!
    Wail for her!
Take balm for her pain.
    Perhaps she may be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
‘Yahweh has produced our righteousness.
    Come, and let’s declare in Zion the work of Yahweh our God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Set up a standard against the walls of Babylon!
    Make the watch strong!
Set the watchmen,
    and prepare the ambushes;
for Yahweh has both purposed and done
    that which he spoke concerning the inhabitants of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You who dwell on many waters, abundant in treasures,
    your end has come, the measure of your covetousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh of Armies has sworn by himself, saying,
    ‘Surely I will fill you with men,
    as with locusts,
    and they will lift up a shout against you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“He has made the earth by his power.
    He has established the world by his wisdom.
    By his understanding he has stretched out the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he utters his voice,
    there is a roar of waters in the heavens,
    and he causes the vapors to ascend from the ends of the earth.
He makes lightning for the rain,
    and brings the wind out of his treasuries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Every man has become stupid and without knowledge.
    Every goldsmith is disappointed by his image,
for his molten images are falsehood,
    and there is no breath in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are vanity,
    a work of delusion.
    In the time of their visitation, they will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The portion of Jacob is not like these,
    for he formed all things,
    including the tribe of his inheritance.
    Yahweh of Armies is his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You are my battle ax and weapons of war.
    With you I will break the nations into pieces.
    With you I will destroy kingdoms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With you I will break in pieces
    the horse and his rider.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With you I will break in pieces
    the chariot and him who rides therein.
With you I will break in pieces
    man and woman.
With you I will break in pieces
    the old man and the youth.
With you I will break in pieces
    the young man and the virgin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With you I will break in pieces
    the shepherd and his flock.
With you I will break in pieces
    the farmer and his yoke.
With you I will break in pieces
    governors and deputies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will render to Babylon and to all the inhabitants of Chaldea all their evil that they have done in Zion in your sight,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, I am against you, destroying mountain,” says Yahweh,
    “which destroys all the earth.
I will stretch out my hand on you,
    roll you down from the rocks,
    and will make you a burned mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Set up a standard in the land!
    Blow the trumpet among the nations!
Prepare the nations against her!
    Call together against her the kingdoms of Ararat, Minni, and Ashkenaz!
Appoint a marshal against her!
    Cause the horses to come up as the swarming locusts!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Prepare against her the nations,
    the kings of the Medes, its governors, and all its deputies, and all the land of their dominion!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The mighty men of Babylon have stopped fighting,
    they remain in their strongholds.
Their might has failed.
    They have become as women.
Her dwelling places are set on fire.
    Her bars are broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One runner will run to meet another,
    and one messenger to meet another,
    to show the king of Babylon that his city is taken on every quarter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So the passages are seized.
    They have burned the reeds with fire.
    The men of war are frightened.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel says:
“The daughter of Babylon is like a threshing floor at the time when it is trodden.
    Yet a little while, and the time of harvest comes for her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon has devoured me.
    He has crushed me.
    He has made me an empty vessel.
He has, like a monster, swallowed me up.
    He has filled his mouth with my delicacies.
    He has cast me out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the violence done to me and to my flesh be on Babylon!”
    the inhabitant of Zion will say; and,
“May my blood be on the inhabitants of Chaldea!”
    will Jerusalem say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore Yahweh says:
“Behold, I will plead your cause,
    and take vengeance for you.
I will dry up her sea,
    and make her fountain dry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Babylon will become heaps,
    a dwelling place for jackals,
    an astonishment, and a hissing,
    without inhabitant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will roar together like young lions.
    They will growl as lions’ cubs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When they are inflamed, I will make their feast,
    and I will make them drunk,
that they may rejoice,
    and sleep a perpetual sleep,
    and not wake up,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will bring them down like lambs to the slaughter,
    like rams with male goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How Sheshach is taken!
    How the praise of the whole earth is seized!
    How Babylon has become a desolation among the nations!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sea has come up on Babylon.
    She is covered with the multitude of its waves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her cities have become a desolation,
    a dry land, and a desert,
    a land in which no man dwells.
    No son of man passes by it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will execute judgment on Bel in Babylon,
    and I will bring out of his mouth that which he has swallowed up.
The nations will not flow any more to him.
    Yes, the wall of Babylon will fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“My people, go away from the middle of her,
    and each of you save yourselves from Yahweh’s fierce anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Don’t let your heart faint.
    Don’t fear for the news that will be heard in the land.
For news will come one year,
    and after that in another year news will come,
    and violence in the land,
    ruler against ruler.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then the heavens and the earth,
    and all that is therein,
will sing for joy over Babylon;
    for the destroyers will come to her from the north,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“As Babylon has caused the slain of Israel to fall,
    so the slain of all the land will fall at Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You who have escaped the sword, go!
    Don’t stand still!
Remember Yahweh from afar,
    and let Jerusalem come into your mind.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“We are confounded
    because we have heard reproach.
Confusion has covered our faces,
    for strangers have come into the sanctuaries of Yahweh’s house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Though Babylon should mount up to the sky,
    and though she should fortify the height of her strength,
    yet destroyers will come to her from me,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The sound of a cry comes from Babylon,
    and of great destruction from the land of the Chaldeans!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Yahweh lays Babylon waste,
    and destroys out of her the great voice!
Their waves roar like many waters.
    The noise of their voice is uttered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the destroyer has come on her,
    even on Babylon.
Her mighty men are taken.
    Their bows are broken in pieces,
for Yahweh is a God of retribution.
    He will surely repay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make her princes, her wise men,
    her governors, her deputies, and her mighty men drunk.
They will sleep a perpetual sleep,
    and not wake up,”
    says the King, whose name is Yahweh of Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh of Armies says:
“The wide walls of Babylon will be utterly overthrown.
    Her high gates will be burned with fire.
The peoples will labor for vanity,
    and the nations for the fire;
    and they will be weary.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word which Jeremiah the prophet commanded Seraiah the son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, when he went with Zedekiah the king of Judah to Babylon in the fourth year of his reign. Now Seraiah was chief quartermaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeremiah wrote in a book all the evil that should come on Babylon, even all these words that are written concerning Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeremiah said to Seraiah, “When you come to Babylon, then see that you read all these words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say, ‘Yahweh, you have spoken concerning this place, to cut it off, that no one will dwell in it, neither man nor animal, but that it will be desolate forever.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be, when you have finished reading this book, that you shall bind a stone to it, and cast it into the middle of the Euphrates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you shall say, ‘Thus will Babylon sink, and will not rise again because of the evil that I will bring on her; and they will be weary.’”
Thus far are the words of Jeremiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he began to reign. He reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Hamutal the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did that which was evil in Yahweh’s sight, according to all that Jehoiakim had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For through Yahweh’s anger this happened in Jerusalem and Judah, until he had cast them out from his presence.
Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the ninth year of his reign, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came, he and all his army, against Jerusalem, and encamped against it; and they built forts against it round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the city was besieged to the eleventh year of King Zedekiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fourth month, in the ninth day of the month, the famine was severe in the city, so that there was no bread for the people of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a breach was made in the city, and all the men of war fled, and went out of the city by night by the way of the gate between the two walls, which was by the king’s garden. Now the Chaldeans were against the city all around. The men of war went toward the Arabah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the army of the Chaldeans pursued the king, and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho; and all his army was scattered from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they took the king, and carried him up to the king of Babylon to Riblah in the land of Hamath; and he pronounced judgment on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king of Babylon killed the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes. He also killed all the princes of Judah in Riblah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put out the eyes of Zedekiah; and the king of Babylon bound him in fetters, and carried him to Babylon, and put him in prison until the day of his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the fifth month, in the tenth day of the month, which was the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard, who stood before the king of Babylon, came into Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He burned Yahweh’s house, and the king’s house; and all the houses of Jerusalem, even every great house, he burned with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the army of the Chaldeans, who were with the captain of the guard, broke down all the walls of Jerusalem all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive of the poorest of the people, and the rest of the people who were left in the city, and those who fell away, who defected to the king of Babylon, and the rest of the multitude.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left of the poorest of the land to be vineyard keepers and farmers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Chaldeans broke the pillars of bronze that were in Yahweh’s house and the bases and the bronze sea that were in Yahweh’s house in pieces, and carried all of their bronze to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also took away the pots, the shovels, the snuffers, the basins, the spoons, and all the vessels of bronze with which they ministered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The captain of the guard took away the cups, the fire pans, the basins, the pots, the lamp stands, the spoons, and the bowls; that which was of gold, as gold, and that which was of silver, as silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took the two pillars, the one sea, and the twelve bronze bulls that were under the bases, which King Solomon had made for Yahweh’s house. The bronze of all these vessels was without weight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the pillars, the height of the one pillar was eighteen cubits; and a line of twelve cubits encircled it; and its thickness was four fingers. It was hollow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A capital of bronze was on it; and the height of the one capital was five cubits, with network and pomegranates on the capital all around, all of bronze. The second pillar also had the same, with pomegranates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were ninety-six pomegranates on the sides; all the pomegranates were one hundred on the network all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, and Zephaniah the second priest, and the three keepers of the threshold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and out of the city he took an officer who was set over the men of war; and seven men of those who saw the king’s face, who were found in the city; and the scribe of the captain of the army, who mustered the people of the land; and sixty men of the people of the land, who were found in the middle of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard took them, and brought them to the king of Babylon to Riblah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king of Babylon struck them, and put them to death at Riblah in the land of Hamath.
So Judah was carried away captive out of his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the number of the people whom Nebuchadnezzar carried away captive:
in the seventh year, three thousand twenty-three Jews;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar, he carried away captive from Jerusalem eight hundred thirty-two persons;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
in the twenty-third year of Nebuchadnezzar, Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive of the Jews seven hundred forty-five people.
All the people numbered four thousand six hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the thirty-seventh year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, in the twenty-fifth day of the month, Evilmerodach king of Babylon, in the first year of his reign, lifted up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah, and released him from prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke kindly to him, and set his throne above the throne of the kings who were with him in Babylon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and changed his prison garments. Jehoiachin ate bread before him continually all the days of his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For his allowance, there was a continual allowance given him by the king of Babylon, every day a portion until the day of his death, all the days of his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator
